Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen T
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel twice now. The rooms are a good size but more importantly they are CLEAN. Good location short walk from Time Square & Macy's store. The staff are friendly & professional, Mathew is very helpful, courteous and always pleasant. Will always be going back to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Wbailey0706
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff was very friendly. Easy check-in. Rooms were fine for an older hotel. Updated. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Hotel rooms are very clean! Staff is Great ! Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rose B
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to New York twice in the past month, alone! I was nervous but upon my arrival the front desk staff was attentive to my needs. The place is VERY Clean!! Staff is upbeat, professional , very helpful. I needed directions to The Bronx and I was given step by step directions from the front desk staff. I was told to call the hotel if I got lost and they would be willing to assist my return to the hotel. I had to leave my luggage at the front while I was working on had to check out and they kept my bags locked and secure. Never once did I feel uneasy or nervous. Cant wait to come back! I am Federal employee and have voiced my liking to your hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Margo293984
Reviews.Content: Hello there, After getting scamed online while getting an apartment to rent during christmas and loosing 600$ my mother, 2 older sisters and myself (17) arrived in new york- not knowing what to do and where to go (after a 10 hour flight) we called a couple hotels in the city and they were all packed. luckily, Comfort Inn understood our story and agreed to take us in for a whole week:) Iv'e stayed in Comfort Inn during Christmas and we had the best time!! The crew is more than great, clean rooms and great breakfast! We enjoyed staying there and felt safe. It's right in the middle of the city and close to all the best shopping stores we could ask for! Better than any apartment we would have gotten to! Thank you so much Comfort Inn, keep the good work up!! I more than recommend staying there! Enjoy xx

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NEW YORK”
Reviews.Author: CABRAGH
Reviews.Content: My family and I are planning our trip to New York from Ireland at the end of this month and we would not stay anywhere else but this hotel. It was recommended to us by a friend about 8 years ago and we have stayed there each time we visited New York since. We too have recommeded it to other friends and they were not disappointed. I could not fault it in any way. It is like home from home. The staff at the front desk are amazing eventhough they are so busy. The athmosphere, the cleanliness of the hotel, the breakfast, Brendan's Bar, its location, everything is top class. Roll on the next few weeks so we can start our holiday in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gibs1012
Reviews.Content: I came here in December with my parents and my sister (we are both in our 20s) and from the moment we arrived, we knew it was going to be a great stay. The staff, although very busy, made us feel warm and welcome and were friendly, cracking jokes. The rooms were a little outdated decor wise, but were clean and warm. The hotel is in an amazing location - just off 5th Avenue and a stone's throw away from Macy's and Broadway. Step outside the hotel and the Empire State Building is just behind you - in fact it so close, you almost don't notice it at first because you're not looking up! Times Square, Grand Central Station and Central Park are all within very reasonable walking distance. This is a great hotel if it is your first time in the 'Big Apple'. Clean, excellent location, friendly, helpful staff, plus the Bar & Grill next door, Brendan's is pretty tasty too! And considering this, the prices aren't too dear either. I would 110% stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money and top location. Just off 5th Avenue and easy walking distance to many areas of NY. Half block from Empire State Bldg and 5 mins walk to Penn Station and 10 min walk to Grand Central which made using the subway excellent. My room was very comfortable and large, The complimentary breakfast was very substantial. I would definitely stay there again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemdelaney
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal for this Hotel, thought the location was excellent i.e slap bang in the middle of Manhatten so good for getting to all parts... Its in quite a busy hectic part so not quiet if that's what you are looking for but v close to Metro. Bedrooms clean and comfortable, good reasonably priced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: beryl007
Reviews.Content: Brill location for time square and Macy's hotel very clean and the beds are so comfy breakfast is continental and good Brendan's bar food excellent and 15% hotel discount well worth a try best wine bar for a glass at the end of the day is metro bar across the road excellent wine and service staff brill in hotel and nothing is to much trouble for them well worth a vist is this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn to the Rescue!”
Reviews.Author: Ebony S
Reviews.Content: Our car broke down in Manhattan during a recent day trip and was taken to a mechanic shop. The car was not going to be ready until the next morning so we were left stranded in New York overnight. I had stayed at the Comfort Inn Manhattan before so I called the to inquire about room availability. Of course, the front desk immediately made a reservation for us an did everything to accommodate us when we arrived; providing toothbrushes, razors, and other necessities. The hotel has a very attractive old-fashioned charm, but is equipped with the latest technology. The room was light and airy with windows covering half of the room. We were also surprised that a full continental breakfast was included with the stay. It was really a great place to be stranded, thanks to the staff at Comfort Inn Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: amy h
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel twice. The last time was 4 years ago for my 50th birthday. Great hotel with almost everything you want to see in this incredible city right on your doorstep. You can perhaps tell that a 3rd visit to New York is on my mind, and this hotel will be the place I will be staying. Comfortable clean rooms, good breakfast and last but by no means least amazingly knowledgable and friendly staff. The beds are also very comfortable and every night, after I had walked my feet off....were very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: homecampo
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely helpful and went out of their way to accommodate us. I would definitely recommend this hotel (and already have) to others. An excellent location and the rooms were very nice and roomy. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gem in the heart of New York City”
Reviews.Author: Nan S
Reviews.Content: During a recent trip to USA my husband and I stayed for nine nights at the Comfort Inn Manhattan. It is a 12 storey hotel in a very central location on 35th Street just around from the Empire State Building. It is a block from Macys Dept Store and close to all the action of Broadway and 10min walk from Times Square. The accommodation was reasonably priced and a continental breakfast was included in the tariff. The hotel had a restaurant on the ground floor but there were lots of eateries nearby which offered great food from a variety of cultures. A free coffee machine was located in the foyer for the use of hotel guests. The only downside was that the hotel didn't have laundry facilities but there was a Laundrymat nearby. The staff on the front desk were helpful and friendly. We were able to store our luggage when we went away on a short tour. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: Carmen789
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the amenities; free Wi-Fi and continental breakfast. The location was great, within walking distance to Empire State Building, Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Access to subway is also on the same block. Rooms were very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We stayed on the 8th floor and never heard any outdoor noise. Decent value for a hotel in midtown Manhattan. They have a locked area to store your luggage if check-out is prior to flight/train departure. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Manhatthan, close to the subway and ESB. The service was fine, when our tap was broken, they fixed it right away. Breakfast is simple, but fine. I would definitely recommand this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent go back again”
Reviews.Author: Max20092001
Reviews.Content: Nicest people ever in the lobby Matthew one of the staff was very friendly and couldnt do enough for you. The hotel is in good location which is good cos u don't have to walk for miles to get to the city centre .I would advise u not to eat a planet Hollywood just round the courner as I got food poisin off in cooked chicken .

Reviews.Title: “great location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: 458jellycat
Reviews.Content: stayed here november 2011 for a week, its location is great as right by Macys and about 6 blocks from Times Square. cant fault it, the continental breakfast is adequate - cereal, bagels, cold boiled eggs, toast, fruit, & doughuts!! room cleaned daily, towels clean daily if required. staff are helpful. comfy beds, rooms fine, and for the amount of time you spend in hotel (very little) apart from sleep, its great. this was my 2nd time at this hotel and I will be staying here again when i go next, i highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: k210
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a friend for a 4 night stay in New York, booked through Virgin. The location of this hotel is fantastic and considering this, we paid a very reasonable price! Many main attractions are within walking distance and subway stations are also close by. Upon arrival we were greeted by Matt who was extremely polite and welcoming as were the other staff who we spoke to. Our room was a decent size with two double beds, it was comfortable and spotless. We also had a walk in wardrobe, iron and ironing board, safe and widescreen tv. The dÃ©cor adds character to the rooms and was not dated. Granted, our view of a brick wall wasn't the best, but who cares! I didn't go to New York to sit in my room and see the sights from the window, I went out. A cooked breakfast was provided on the first morning as we booked through Virgin and a continental breakfast which was enough to set us up for the day was available for the other mornings. Checking in and out was hassle free and on the day we left we were able to store our suitcases in the reception while we went out, before returning for our transfer to the airport. To sum it up, the Comfort Inn was more than we could have hoped for and I really don't know how people can fault it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: ag06 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel is fantastic for walking in NY, night and day. It is near 5th and Broadway, ESB, times square........... Suppershuttle is OK from airport to the hotel and back. You can print your card for come back by plane at the hotel. breakfast could be better but it is correct. In february, rooms were or too hot or not enought hot but they were clean. Thereisn't sun in rooms at the 2nd floor but in mine, I saw ESB. Just a problem with the price. The man didn't look at the voutchers and asked 3400$ for a room which price was 979$ on the voutcher !!! he has changed after but it was a bad surprise after 10 hours traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel4fun747
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a weekend stay in NYC. The staff was friendly and informative, and the rooms, though small, were pleasant. The free breakfast was a plus. The historic hotel is situated in Mid-Town and just steps from Broadway. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes!!! We will come again!!! Great Hotel Exellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ines D
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults en 2 childeren) stayed in de CFInn for 3 nights and the hotel/location was EXELLENT.., Yes when we come again, we will stay at the same hotel. The room we stayed in was at the 8th floor. The room was very clean, the beds were soooo nice for a good night sleep, because you FEEL youre FEET at the end of the day!!. Very nice and lovely breakfast and the very good and Delicious donuts!! Only if you wanted scrambeld eggs you had to buy them. Free coffee at the reception desk, at all times of the day, nice service. Every day towl change. Housekeep A+ Thanks for making oure stay as complete as possible. We checked out at ten in de morning and left our bags in storage, and that was no problem. We came back for our bags at 2 in the afternoon and also that was no problem. Location was so super!!! Next to Victoria Secrets/GaP/Macy/Subway/Broadway/PeNNstation/MadisonSquareGarden/Great food. We had to go to Newark Liberty airport, thats was a very easy transport....People it was so easy...The hotel is a 10 minute walk to PeNN Station you take the Amtrak-train to Newark Liberty Airport (30 minutes) and than 5 minutes in the AirTrain (comes with every two minutes) it will take you to youre own Airport Section A,B,C. This transport is 12.50 $ per person, and we paid 25.00 $ and the childeren untill 12 are FREE. Because they will charge you 60/70 $ by Cab and 16,50 $ by Bus..So this is the sheapist way at very fast to comute. But a frendly hotelguest told us about this option. The reception didn't know. Free internet en free printing. The COMFORT INN....GREAT...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- fab location!”
Reviews.Author: Helen N
Reviews.Content: have recently been to this hotel with a small group. all the staff apart from one were very friendly- especially Mathew who helped organise transfers and store luggage. The bedrooms were fine and the breakfast completely acceptable. the location is great, being a few minutes from Macys!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located and lives up to its name ... very comfy!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa Q
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter stayed here for 4 nights and got back this morning. I have to agree with another 'reviewer' - really comfy beds, lives up to the hotel name. This is a very comfortable, friendly hotel in an ideal location for sightseeing: Less than 3 minutes walk to Macys and around 15 mins walk to Times Square. Matt on reception made our stay extra special. ..... so helpful, kind and great humoured! Breakfast is more than adequate and again all the staff helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel to our family and friends. Real value for money. It wasn't even that noisy at nights. Lisa, Chelmsford

Reviews.Title: “Great location, read this review”
Reviews.Author: Troy H
Reviews.Content: In regards to location it couldn't be better, with Macy's Time Square and Empire State Building within minutes walking distance could not flat at all. Now with regards to the hotel you must remember this is a budget hotel, no frills just honest accommodation. Staff thought out are welcoming and helpful the breakfast is acceptable as long as you like bagels or toast (hot breakfast is available at a cost) and there is free coffee or tea available however you have to get it from a machine in the lobby. Bad bits. Rooms are basic and beds are small. Through out the corridors there is a smell of tobacco however once in your room the smell sees to disappear. Shower is ok but tends to fluctuate between hot and cold whilst having a shower and toilet seems to get blocked easily (opps) All in all I think you could sum up by saying that the hotel is old and could do with a little updating but as I said at the beginning this is a budget hotel and if you want posh then pay a little more and don't stay here. All in all perfect stay for the time we were here.

Reviews.Title: “great location, noisy, dark room with view of a brick wall.”
Reviews.Author: inkypenn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and staff friendly, especially Matthew. I was staying with my husband and 16year old son (and paid for 3 adults). We were given a small dark corner room with a view of a brick wall. We requested a change of room and was offered another corner room with a slightly better view of a brick wall and fire exit, this did however have slightly more light. The only other room offered had one queen bed and a pull out sofa bed (which we had been told are very uncomfortable). With little choice we accepted the 2nd corner room and tried to make the most of our 4 night break. However we were woken at midnight from the noise in the next room which was due to an adjoining door, we could hear everything from that room, talking, laughing etc. The second night we had to bang on the wall for them to be quiet so that we could get some sleep. The beds were quite comfortable but sleep quality due to noise was poor. I did mention this to the Virgin rep whose answer was to speak to reception. Bathroom was also very cold in the mornings. Overall the hotel is adequate if you do not have high expectations and rooms are clean enough. Breakfast is sufficient but they do run out of certain food if you are a little late down. Free coffee is good. Food at Brendans was good, didn't think food at Playwright Irish Bar was that good even with 20% discount.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tammy P
Reviews.Content: Staying in NYC for the first time can be a bit intimidating, but the Comfort Inn Manhattan helped us feel right at home. The folks at the front desk were always very accomodating, and eager to assist us with all of our 'touristy' questions. We walked everywhere or took the metro. My only negative was the breakfast, which is the usual, starchy, carbo loaded choices.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB YET AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: lancslads
Reviews.Content: Another superb 5 day break in New York, we stayed at the Comfort Inn again, we definitely still recommend this hotel, superb quality, excellent size room, very clean, really good bathroom facilities, just all round value for money. The staff and management provide excellent customer service. Breakfast is good and sufficient for a start to the day. There is nothing at all negative about the hotel and staff. We will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Our first holiday in New York”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and we wanted to be close to all of the attractions of this great city. We chose this hotel for its location, just around the corner from the Empire State building and Macy's, a subway ride to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, and short walks to the UN building, Grand Central Station, Broadway, Times Square, Central Park and the Museums, and because in the last year we have stayed at a number of hotels in the Choice Hotel Group and all have given us great value for money. This hotel did not let us down. It has provided the best levels of service we have experienced to date from within the Choice Hotel Group,and also the continental breakfast really set us up for the day. All of the staff went out of their way to be helpful and ensure our stay New York was memorable

Reviews.Title: “every thing we expected”
Reviews.Author: louise k
Reviews.Content: this was our 3rd trip to n.y. we have stayed in different hotels each time. the thing that atracted us to this hotel was the breakfast inc in the cost. the reception and staff were very polite and welcoming. the virgin rep was also very helpfull. the first day we were given a cooked breakfast, which kept us going all day. the rest of the holiday the breakfast was bagels, cereals, toast, and pastries. all drinks, tea, coffee, juice was inc. the lounge staff were lovley. free coffe was available through-out the day, even to-go, or to take to your room. we had a veiw of the empire state from our window which was an added bonus. our rooms were warm, clean, and comfortable. my sons room was cooler and had noisy rad, but didnt impac ton his time there. over-all this was a very friendly little hotel, with kind staff, and a prime location. not the most expensive of hotels but shabby chique,and cozy goes a long way. we would deffenatley go back to this hotel. g.v.m it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great price, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: asaltydog78
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my adult son for his first NYC Job interview (Jan 2012). Easy access to this hotel via Lincoln Tunnel (40th St to hotel - 35th St leaving). Discount at Meyer's Parking; 1/4 Block from hotel on 35th St (1 day = $27 instead of full price of $42). "Mathew" and "Victor" at front desk were extremely helpful. This is a vintage hotel from the 20s - 30s updated as possible. Met many British and European Vacationers in "Cozy" elevators. Brendan's Restaurant (connected to hotel) excellent food, reasonable NYC price. Requested a late Checkout - no problem. This Hotel was an overall great choice for Mid-town Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing and noisy but so close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Diane B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally a sixty second walk from herald square and macys, which makes it ideal for times square, central park and all of the other main sights. The empire state can actually be seen from the back of the hotel! The staff in the main are friendly, there is free coffee in the lobby and the free breakfast is a useful. Note the breakfast consists of cereals, juices, bagels, waffles and toast (and cold boiled eggs for some odd reason) and not hot cooked food. The reason I've not given this hotel more stars and would not return is due to the fact that the hotel is freezing and noisy, and I don't mean from traffic outside. The pipes clunk all the way through the night so it woke me up at 2am and then hourly until 6am when we finally gave in and got up. This happened every night. Plus even with the heater on the room was unbearably cold. A shame really as the hotels location really is fantastic but it just doesn't provide it's actual purpose- the possibility for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of New York”
Reviews.Author: ariane s
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with 3 of my friends (we are all 18 years old). The hotel was very simple, but clean. The rooms were large enough and the included breakfast helped us remain on budget. The staff was nice, but a little slow during the check-in and check-out. The location was perfect. The subway is a 30 second walk, Macy's is at the end of the street. Many stores on 5th Avenue are minutes away. It's also a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square and a 10 minute walk to Grand Central. I would definitely stay there again, as the location is very convenient and the price is right. My only complaint would be the noise on the street. I was on the 11th floor, but still managed to hear all the cars and people talking in the streets below. The lack of soundproof windows disturbed my sleep on the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PMC25052005
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner spent 8 nights here from 20th December 2011 - 28th December 2011 and it was an ideal hotel for what we needed. It is located in a perfect location. The Empire State building is on the next street and we even had a few of it from our very spacious room. Macys is at the end of the street along with a subway station that is very easy to use where ever you wish to go in New York. Penn station is only a couple of blocks away as is Times Square. Everything is within walking distance of this hotel. Free tea and coffee was provided which was useful and also the free wireless internet access was great. The brakfast in the morning wasnt great and there was always a massive queue but it was a busy time of the year. The breakfast was enough tho to get us through to lunch time and saved us probaby about $20 a day. For the price of the hotel I would definately recommend this hotel to people.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RenaA
Reviews.Content: Just back from 7 nights in this hotel and we enjoyed everything about it. The location is excellent. The service is very good, the front desk staff are very helpful and the rest of the staff very friendly. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The breakfast provides a good start to the day. We highly recommend this hotel for an enjoyable stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing places in the middle of New York:)”
Reviews.Author: susan522
Reviews.Content: Just been for a 4day city break.The hotel is v central close to Empire state building,maceys and Time sq.Great staff v helpful and entertaining especially Mathew.Good all round hotel xxxbeds v comfy as well slept like a logx

Reviews.Title: “warm and cosy”
Reviews.Author: lucyBuffaloNewYork
Reviews.Content: The best part of visiting NY is staying at this hotel. We just stayed here (Dec.26-28,2011)for the 2nd time in as many years. The rooms are very clean,the beds are comfortable,and the WiFi is fast and free. Plus, the hotel is very quiet.The desk staff is very friendly and helpful.Kudos to Matthew and Brian,but we've found everyone to be great. Even my husband,who hates to travel, willingly will go to NY if I promise we can stay here. The location is also the best - you are close to everything,and within walking distance to Penn Station. This is our #1 choice for staying in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rehabnet
Reviews.Content: Returned to NYC after several years, with my family. Small room. Small elevator. Good and convenient location: close to Penn station. Easy pickup by airport shuttle. Half a block to subway station, and the now pedestrian section of Broadway. Ongoing construction work was a minor hassle. It is good that breakfast and wi-fi are included in rate. I would return myself and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Would gladly stay here again ... just a couple of small annoyances”
Reviews.Author: craig78681
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Christmas Day, 2011 and spent 5 nights. I had read a lot of negative comments about the common size of Manhattan hotel rooms (SMALL!), but was pleasantly surprised when we opened the door. There certainly wasn't a lavish amount of extra space, but I was expecting to have to squeeze between the wall and the bed in order to get in and out of the bed. See the attached photo. Our room was a corner room on the east side of the 9th floor facing the street (#904). The king size bed was comfortable and the storage space in the chest and closet was more than adequate for the two of us. The in-room safe ($1/day) was a great convenience for protecting cash. The TV was a good size flat screen mounted on the wall and had HD capability. The list of available stations was more that adequate (who spends time in New York watching TV anyway? :) ). The bathroom was small, having room only for a tub/shower, commode and pedestal sink. You arenâ€™t going to spread out all your stuff in this one. The two strongest points for this property are the reasons I would gladly stay here again: 1) location, and 2) staff. The front door is half-block from Herald Square where one of the larger subway stations is located. Leaving the front door you turn left and can enter the subway before you come to the first intersection at 6th Ave. (Avenue of the Americas). Macyâ€™s is on the west side of Herald Square. The Empire State Building is about a block and half to the southwest (get there before 9:30 and you probably wonâ€™t have to wait in much of a line; buy your tickets ahead of time online to reduce your waiting even more). Bryant Park, the New York Public Library, Times Square, Grand Central Station, Madison Square Garden and Penn Station are all within easy walking distance. We did not have much occasion to interact with hotel staff members but when we did they were friendly and helpful. I was glad to see that they did not have bell hops waiting to take our bags and our money. We had to check out a number of hours before we needed to head to the airport and they gladly held our luggage in a locked closet until we were ready to leave. The power went off in our room one morning when we were getting ready. I called the front desk and it was back on in no more than 5 minutes. We encountered 2 minor annoyances. I shower in the evening and my wife showers in the morning. I never had this problem but she had a very hard time regulating the water for a constant temperature. We wondered if this was due to a larger number of people showering in the morning than in the evening. The breakfast area is the most disappointing. It does not handle a large crowd well. Thereâ€™s plenty of seating as far as I can tell but the line at the toasters can be very long if you donâ€™t arrive before 8:00. The food available was adequate but not memorable: instant oatmeal, cold serial, donuts, boiled eggs, oranges, apples, bagels, toast, orange juice, apple juince and coffee. You certainly wonâ€™t leave hungry, but you wonâ€™t be delighted either. There is no read-to-cook waffle batter. Itâ€™s just as well. Youâ€™d probably be in line for 20-30 minutes during the peak morning rush. I have a non-hotel tip for you. There were 5 of us traveling together. Thatâ€™s not a very cab-friendly number. Carmel Limo (--) provided great service at $60-65 each way plus tip from/to LaGuardia. I would certainly use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC often but rarely overnight. However when I do stay I always look for this hotel as it is convenient to mid town Manhattan AND is always a great stay. The hotel is quaint, yet updated to typical Comfort Inn standards. Price? Always a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming in 2012”
Reviews.Author: Neena1121
Reviews.Content: Comfort Inn on 39th street was great when we got there they told us they overbooked and my double wasn't available. So what did they do, they set us up with 2 king rooms instead. THAT is customer service ! Can't complain they accommodated us. The rooms are tight but we are in the city. The only problem I had was the tv channel were all messed up so we had like 3 channels to watch. They have a free breakfast that was good, the staff are all friendly from the front desk, cleaning staff to the young lady working the breakfast. I would stay here again, their price was a fraction of what the other hotels were charging and it was right in the middle of the festivities!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel and can't wait to do it again. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. My wife had a problem with her coat zipper, instead of sending us to someplace to fix it, Matthew the doorman went out of his way to fix it for her. The room was comfortable and clean. I would highly recommend staying here. The restaurant, Brendans was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Brief pre-Christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: Jez_H-London
Reviews.Content: Very well-placed for key mid-town locations. Room (as expected) quite small with limited facilities, but that was fine. Good shower and heating facilities in room. Used wi-fi service - worked perfectly. Staff very helpful on few occasions we needed them. Could see Empire State from window!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wexford_IrelandGay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Comfort Inn Manhattan in November/December 2011. This is my 8th year staying there and I would definitely recommend it. The location is excellent. Rooms are spotless with really comfortable beds. Bathroom old, but could not fault it. I always find the staff to be polite and friendly. During this trip my credit card was stolen when out shopping and as always staff were extremely helpful. On returning to the hotel the receptionist (Gulbyie) immediately helped out by contacting the credit card company for me which was a lifesaver because my mobile phone did not work on this trip. I also needed to contact the Apple online store before I left NYC because an item hadn't been delivered and while there was a problem with the land lines, Diana (receptionist on night duty) came up trumps and came to my aid by dialling the number on her personal cell phone (fantastic). On the day we left the hotel Matthew was more than helpful with our luggage (and there was a lot of it !) I hope to be back at this hotel again in Nov/Dec 2012 and in the meantime I will recommend it to any of my friends who are travelling to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Chignon
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is an old school place- no temporary feeling here. Heavy maple doors, marble staircase, just beautiful. Slightly marred by some post modern renovation (fake granite pillars) and bad fluorescent lighting. As many others have mentioned, Matthew is great- welcoming and steered us towards an equally charming diner in the area: the Tic Toc. As far as cleanliness I didn't see any problems and I was a hotel maid for several years so I can be trusted on this matter. Maybe we lucked out with our room. But it was clean and up to date. As far as negatives, only 2 things: 1) Room was too hot- much too hot. Desk clerk suggested turning on AC which is ridiculous in December but it did even out temp. Still, I wish the windows could have been opened. 2) Breakfast was deplorable. Don't bother. Don't bother with small cafe next door- equally bad. Wound up going to patisserie on 5th for a real bagel and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “good location needs updating”
Reviews.Author: MATT123670
Reviews.Content: stayed just before Christmas checked in late staff were friendly, got to room on the 9TH floor lifts were very small and very often used by the cleaning staff so often had to wait for lifts. sleeping was often interrupted by the door outside the lift banging, we also had a large gap on the room door where you could see the bed through the door. on to the bathroom where if you wanted hot water you would have to run the water for 10 minutes to get any then it would either scald you or freeze you through the shower, the radiators would also come on at odd times and make a lot of noise and over heat the room during the night. the rooms themselves were very dark the windows very grubby they were average in cleanliness. beds were comfortable, breakfast was average for a continental breakfast but far from deluxe as claimed although there were 2 toasters only 1 side on each toaster was working causing a queue, on the plus side the location was very good with most things in walking distance ideal for macys the empire state building and times square. all in all it was an average hotel in a good location but in need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: Tony L
Reviews.Content: Do not even think about booking this Inn, it is filthy, the breakfast bread is restocked from dirty carrier bags the rooms are filthy the windows and curtains have never been cleaned the staff are rude the lifts breaks down and we were told parts had been ordered and could take several weeks to repair, we booked through Virgin Aug 2011, you have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheWickerMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Comfort Inn Manhattan recently. the hotel is in a great location only a 2 minute walk to Macy's and the Empire State Building just behind the hotel on 34th St. Rooms very clean, very comfortable bed, could have had better lighting though. Breakfast good, cereal, eggs, bagels, toast, but plastic plates, cups and cutlery. As earlier posts have said staff very helpful especially Mathew, staff booked our tours and transport back to JFK. Brendans also a good place to eat if you want to eat close by. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Carole B
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Comfort Inn Manhattan with a group of 25 in 8 rooms and everyone was very pleased with their stay. This hotel is central located. Macy's at one end of street and 5th Ave at the other end. The hotel is old but has a charm about it! It was clean, staff was very helpful, coffee and hot tea in lobby 24 hrs. This was my second stay here and I will be back in the future. We love Brendan's (restraunt/bar). It is very easy to walk to anyplace you want to go in New York. Can't beat the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy!”
Reviews.Author: Hege_71
Reviews.Content: We were incredibly dissapointed with this hotel, as what you see in the travel brochure and on the internet is certainly what you get!! No we understand that unless you pay insane money your expectations in New York shouldn't be high from the get go, but you shouldn't feel disgusted. In the first instance we arrived in the room and about died when we opened the door, we had been given a smoking room, which we had not requested, and it was like walking into an ashtray. Now I am a smoker and my husband is not, so usually I would be over the moon, but when as a smoker you can't even bear the smell something is very wrong. They kindly changed our room, but that turned out not much better. Although the smelly smoke was no longer a problem we now moved on to just as uncomfortable smells which shall remain nameless. It was the cleanliness that got to us this time, it was that bad we couldn't bear to walk around without shoes on. We did little things on purpose just to see if it would be cleaned/tidied but NOPE!!!! And then suddenly when we only had two days left (we where there for a week) it seemed new cleaners came in and it was suddenly very clean............I will give them though they had incredibly friendly staff. But I wouldn't really recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Nyclover23
Reviews.Content: I was a little dubious about the reviews posted on here however I was very pleasently surprised!!! The room was huge we had a double double which was double the size of the room we had at heathrow prior to the flight!! The bathroom was also big and have everything we needed. The location was brilliant just 2 minutes from Macy's and 10 from empire state!!! The breakfast too was fine yes there were plastic plates etc but anywhere you went in NYC that's what you got. The only negative I had was that I requested a non smoking room and of course we got a smoking room we asked twice to move and each time they said it would be the next day in the end we left it but we were hardly in the room and just opened the windows. What a brilliant brilliant hotel. I'm already planning my next trip. Thank you so so so much comfort inn!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Place reasonably priced and close to Macy's and MSG”
Reviews.Author: SIGNALS123
Reviews.Content: Great place if you wanted to shiop until you dropped at Macy's. We were only 1/2 block away and the su=bway was less than that. We only stayed one night, had a room on the top floor with two beds that was huge. Never heard any street noise other than the occassional siren. Everything was clean and in order. We walked to the basketball doubleheader at MSG on Saturday in about seven minutes. Location is tops. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time just as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: tparoxtar
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Comfort Inn Manhattan, and I am pleased to report the room was still very large for NYC--honestly, it was pretty large for any hotel in this price range, and still the best bang for the buck! Rooms are clean, staff is courteous and it's half a block to Herald Square, making it very convenient to pretty much everything. The breakfast bar offers cereal, bagels, eggo style waffles and other baked goods. Also, there is a small computer setup for any basic computing needs--such as when I needed to print out e-tix and contracts. Laser printer printed great and was very easy to use. I believe we have found our base for any trip into the city and I definitely can recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “would go again!”
Reviews.Author: N_elGriego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location, just 10 min. walk from times square and has a metro station just a few steps from the lobby.The staff was polite and helpfull and the rooms confortable.The price was good for a hotel in that area including breakfast, and I would certainly go again.I would only ask for more choise in the breakfast buffet and better plumbing but without being dissatisfied...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, decent hotel, with a problem....”
Reviews.Author: x57114
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located just down the street from Macy's and several wonderful shopping locations. The problem for me was the "fire" doors that separated the rooms from the elevators. They made the most ridiculous about of noise every time they were walked through (which in the morning was the absolute worst). It took a hotel with a great location, free breakfast, clean rooms, overall generally decent hotel and made the stay almost unbearable. I think the ability to sleep well and without distraction is one of the primary qualities in a hotel and because of this issue, I would not recommend this hotel. If you do decide to stay at this hotel absolutely ask for a room away from the elevators!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen d
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a excellent location, just around the corner from Maceys, we stayed there for 5nights my mum my daughter and myself, room was comfy. Breakfast was good for what you get it lasts you through the day. Brendans restaurant does excellent burgers and other food. Would definately stay there again. The staff are very helpfull especially Matthew

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fozzy09
Reviews.Content: Just came back after a 4 night stay at the Comfort Inn, Manhattan. The hotel offers everything you could want, ideal location, friendly staff, clean rooms and a complimentary breakfast (which I believe is rare in the US) although as someone has mentioned the plastic knives weren't very useful. Macy's at the bottom of the road, as is the subway and Empire State Building round the corner - what more could you ask for? Very good value. Would recommend anyone to stay there, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: lrobertsw
Reviews.Content: I just spent four nights at this hotel. There were good and bad aspects to it. The room itself was large and the beds were comfortable. There was plenty of space to unpack if you wanted to use the drawers and closet. There was also a safe in the closet so that was great for storing your passport during the visit. There was also a microwave and fridge in the room. The bathroom was pretty basic but there was everything you needed. The staff at the front desk were not very friendly and didn't seem to speak much English I found. The two elevators were tiny, the size of a closet, and one was not functioning the entire time we were there. The stairs are made of marble and are very twisty, I don't know how they expected seniors to walk up 12 flights of stairs, I found it quite hazardous. In fact when we were there two people actually got stuck in the elevator and the fire department had to come and get them out. As well all of the vending machines were out of order so there was nowhere to purchase water without leaving the hotel. The continental breakfast was not great, cold boiled eggs and no butter, no peanut butter or anything like that. I guess for downtown Manhattan the price was right but I wouldn't choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in NY”
Reviews.Author: anonela
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th visit to New York city and this hotel was the best value for money so far. The room was spacious compared to the other hotel rooms in NY, the staff were friendly, the location excellent and on Macy's doorstep, the included breakfast was unbeatable. Best bits: view of empire state building from our room, bountiful breakfast, comfortable bed, cleanliness. I would definitely return here. Some negatives - only one lift working, shower either very hot or very cold (couldn't get it just right)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot.”
Reviews.Author: Liam H
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the US for the first time with my wife and daughter to compete in the NYC marathon. My good friend who is form my home town in Ireland Geraldine, from the Legends Bar just round the corner recommended The Comfort Inn. We were definitely not disappointed as the hotel was excellent with nice clean and tidy rooms and bathroom facilities. The breakfast was as much as you could eat which set you up nicely for a good days sightseeing. The great thing also was that the Comfort Inn was so very central and was walking distance to nearly everywhere. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, should you have to talk to the cleaners, waiters, porters, lobby staff or receptionists. I would have to make a special mention to the great attention from Victor, and especially to Matthew whom we bonded with as soon as we walked in through the doors to sign in. He is a great ambassador to your hotel for his all round effort in pleasing the customers. To me he felt like a long lost brother, which is how highly of regard myself, my wife and daughter thought of him. The lobby had tea and coffee plus the use of a PC available at all times which was impressive too. Cannot rate the hotel and staff highly enough and we will definitely be back again in the future. Liam Mc Hugh.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HHDXB
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn should be one of those chains of hotels where you should expect the mediocre standard that comes with the price. Unfortunately this one just didn't quite cut the grade, although it was comfortable. The rooms were always clean, the bed was comfortable and there was plenty of cupboard space. The decor and the bathroom were a bit antiquated, and so much unnecessary furniture was crammed into the room that it made the room smaller. The windows and the gauze hadn't been cleaned in I don't know how long, which made the already dark room darker, and the radiator would randomly come on and off making the room hotter than I wanted. The elevator was also extremely slow and small so when it was full you had to wait an extra long time...or use the stairs, which is what I usually just did anyway. The breakfast that comes in the package is not great - don't expect wonders! Bagels, Waffles, bread, pre-peeled boiled eggs on paper plates and juice in plastic cups. The staff were mostly oblivious to your presence. Can't say they were unfriendly, but they certainly didn't go out of their way to make you feel welcome, which was disappointing considering the mostly friendly staff I had experienced in the other hotels I stayed in. I would only stay here again if I couldn't get in anywhere else to be honest, I think there are better options in the same vicinity/street. Location was great. Subway right on the corner, and between 5th and 6th Avenue, so shopping haven

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: robx67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our honeymoon in NYC! We arrived Saturday for a 3 Night stay in the Big Apple. Our primary destination was Madison Square Garden for the Foo Fighters Concert Sunday night! We had a fantastic time. Everything was within walking distance of this awesome little hotel. Sure its noisy and the bathrooms are small, but hey, when you're in New York, who in the heck has time to stay in the room! Upon our arrival to the airport, there was a gentleman who seemed a little shady asking in a low tone if we needed a ride to the city in his limo. We met a friend on the way in on our flight, and we decided to take him up on the offer. It turned out to be a great deal! 65.00 into the city in a limo. You cant beat that. These guys are just trying to make a living, so you can't blame them for hustling a little bit. Anyway, after seeing some of these cab drivers while I was there, I am glad my money went to the limo driver. The concierge/door person at the hotel (bad of me not to get his name!!) was extremely friendly and helpful. I even observed him giving a foot massage to a guest on the second night of our stay. Talk about hospitality! Ms. Franklin, the reservationist at the hotel was also very helpful with our accommodations. She was the icing on the cake making sure my wife and I had a nice 35th St view. Thank You!!!! I cannot say enough about our experience and the hotel. Planning on taking my mother-in-law and aunt next year, and of course, plan to stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JASONPERROTT
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights, great location, easy to get to places, room fine stayed on 3rd floor food at brendan`s vice night recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Would stay again....”
Reviews.Author: Mountain_civic
Reviews.Content: Reasonable priced hotel for the area and great location. Just four blocks from Penn Station and Macyâ€™s is a half block away. The hotel is six blocks from Time Square which makes it easy to walk to restaurants, theaters, etcâ€¦. One subway is at the end of the block and Penn Station is close by for more direct routes to Lower Manhattan for the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Ground Zero, etcâ€¦ It was nice to be near Times Square to enjoy the stores and atmosphere, but get away from the noise of Time Square. Our room wasnâ€™t huge but by older, city rooms standards it was large and had plenty of space, but no room for a refrigerator which many Comfort Inn's have. The bathroom was a bit tiny, but functional. The staff was very helpful with suggestions for sights seeing, places to eat, etcâ€¦ My husband forgot his cell phone charger and they had extras which they allowed him to use during our stay. Even though the building is older, the hotel room don't look old at all and were very clean. The maids were very nice and friendly when we passed the in the hallway. Breakfast was included with the room. Waffles, bagels, fruits, cereals, toast, etcâ€¦. which was enough to start the day. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirstenmc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. The location couldnt be better. It is located in the next street to the empire state building. Our room on the 11th floor at the rear of the hotel had an unobstructed view of the ESB. The hotel decor is old fashioned classic luxury. Dark wood, cream walls just perfectly. When we arrived we were greated by a lovely concierge and receptionist. We were both tired from our journey and the receptionist pointed us in the direction of the free tea and coffee machine situated next to the extremely comfy sofa. Our room was lovely not huge but big by new york room size standards. It was big enough to fit a large king size bed, bedside tables, a small table and two chairs and a large chest of drawers. Yes the bathroom is small but perfectly formed and has a full size bath. The location is excellent. 30 second walk to the subway, 1 minute walk to Macys. Lots of shops and restaurants closeby. Brendans bar and restaurant adjoins the hotel. Eat there the food is amazing. We ate there 3 out of the 6 nights we stayed. Breakfast is served in the restaurant in the morning. It is free and has a huge selection. Waffles toast bagels every type of donuts fillings jams cheese eggs, tea coffee juice. U also have an option to update to cooked breakfast if you wish I thoroughly recommend staying at this hotel. We are already saving up for our next visit. We cant thank the staff enough for our fabulous stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: nevillcanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location -- 1/2 a block from Macy's, down the block and around the corner from the Empire State building, and just steps from the subway! The lobby is air conditioned and has complimentary coffee. The staff are very friendly. The elevator and hallways are hot (it was July) but not a problem as we didn't spend any length of time in them. The room was spacious with a big walk in closet, decent size renovated bathroom, comfortable beds, and a flat screen tv. The air conditioner worked well but was noisy. Better than be hot! Complimentary continental breakfast was served every morning in Brendan's, the restaurant connected to the lobby. The only protein was boiled eggs but everything available tasted fine. You could order a hot breakfast if you wanted. Tip: Brendan's is a FANTASTIC place for supper! The prawns are to die for! We had an absolutely fantastic trip and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “close to town sqare”
Reviews.Author: alanajanice j
Reviews.Content: hello if you are reading this review first of all thank you for reading my review you should always go to comfort inn coz it is really cool you have a buffey breakfast everything you could want for breakfast 10 mins away from empire state building and 2 mins away from subway five to ten mins walk to town sqare are room was always clean staff were really nice and friendly if you need to go on the computer coz they have a 20 mins free on it and plus two beds in one room cool right well i hope you go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaJP
Reviews.Content: Between the 5th and 6th aves, short walk to Times Sq and very close to the subway. This was the perfect choice for my 1st time in NY with my family as it was a good hotel in a nice area, very central. Hotel is a little bit old fashioned, but clean. Very friendly staff, Id definitely recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “great location but hotel needs updating- 6 day stay 26 oct to 1 Nov”
Reviews.Author: Wurzel2406
Reviews.Content: Hi we stayed here for 6 days - 2 adults and a teen - staff lovely, location ace - as others say short walk to Times Square and pretty central. We were on second floor (211) in a room with 2 x double beds. Hotel is very tired and needs a revamp but is fairly clean. Room quite spacious - decked out in very dated furniture but quirky - we had a window that looked out onto a wall so no natural light but as we were out most of the time it was not an issue. Plenty of room to store suitcases etc. Our room was very quiet with little street noise. We went to breakfast once but didnt stay as did not suit us - limited appeal and choice. We did however go right out of hotel to end of street and crossed road to the Oxford Cafe on 5th Ave next to pret a manger - 1 minute walk. Daughter had 3 huge fresh panckes with maple syrup for just over 3 dollars which we shared and hubby had egg, bcaon, sausage roll - fresh orange juice, coffee and hot chocolate all for 18 dollars. We went to the bar next (Brendans) to hotel for evening drinks after our days out and you can access hotel through interconnecting door. Nice atmosphere - paid 8 dollars for red wine ; 7 dollars for pint guiness. We ate there once and had a nice meal and you get 15% discount. You have to book out at noon but if your flight is later they will keep suitcases in a locked room in foyer which was helpful as we didnt need to leave for JFK til 230 pm. We walked everywhere in NY - i lost half a stone ! You see so much more by doing this and all within reasonable distance. We booked this hotel as so cheap compared to others - but if we returned to NY, which is unlikely, we would try elsewhere. For those of you looking at this re booking through Virgin - we booked flights separately with Virgin and hotel through bookings.com for total of Â£2300 instead of the Â£3600 Virgin wanted for a package. So to conclude - great location / tired hotel but adequate if you are not looking for anything special. x

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: juliejelliebean
Reviews.Content: Just behind the Empire State Building which we could view from our room, this hotel looks quite disappointing from the outside but the location is second to none and the staff are friendly and the hotel has everything you may need. We had two rooms for our family next to each other at the 'back' of the hotel and could see the Empire State building through the windows - amazing. Manhattan restaurants, bars and shops are within easy walking distance and within a day you have found your feet. The hotel is a little oasis of calm in a hectic city. Walking around at night you felt safe and able to visit local bars (karaoke rooms along the street) and other bars towards the iron building. Subway only about 50 yrds away too next to Maceys.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York”
Reviews.Author: fairyglen118
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a hotel in a better location ! , we stayed for 2 nights 23- 25th October following our cruise to New York . We arrived just after 7am our bags was placed into storage and as we walked around the corner ..... Empire state building - wow ! , so close to many of midtown attractions & off course SHOPS ! , Macy's is left out of hotel & across the road ! . Hotel quirky boutique style , our room on 8th floor lovely , spotlessly clean & really friendly staff , if we're lucky enough to go to the big apple again I would stay at the comfort inn again . Continental Bfast is also included , we only had a few drinks in Brendans Bar which is attached to the hotel , but the menu looked good. Couple of good Irish bars across from hotel & Keens Chophouse next street - fabulous !

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel to stay in for location”
Reviews.Author: blondie33WildTourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a really good spot for shopping and sightseeing just around the block from Empire State and over the road from Macy's. There is an Irish bar over the rd. Food good,rooms nice 2 queen sized beds in room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn, Manhattan, New York”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Comfort Inn for 4 nights and five days. The hotel is in an ideal position for getting out and about, only one block away from the Empire State Building, and within walking distance of others. Plenty of restuarants and fast food shops close by. Our room was clean, with 2 queen beds which were very comfortable, nice bathroom with fresh towels each day. Matthew was so very helpful in everything, nothing too much trouble and a pleasure to talk to. He also arranged a car to take us back to the airport on our last day. The rest of the hotel staff were very polite and helpful and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “comfort inn manhattan”
Reviews.Author: derbyengland
Reviews.Content: hi i stayed here for 5 nights with my partner from the 9 oct the hotel is in the right place to get to everythink and the staff are very help full the only problem i had was that the bed was a bit small ( they said it was a queen size ) but i think it was a normal double ,,but hey you only sleep in it so not a big problem ,,the breakfast you get is ok just to start the day off so if your looking for a clean good location hotel then look no further

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: What can I say ........ this stay was the best my Fiance and I have ever had, and we're already planning on coming back again! Our stay was from September 10 to the 27th, and we were made to feel like family right from the start. We had traveled from the west coast all the way to the east coast over 2 months, with New york being our last stop, and the Comfort Inn Manhattan was the icing on the cake. We booked a few months in advance, and asked for a nice room, with a view, and we weren't disappointed. We were given a great room close to the top, with a great view of the Empire State Building. The room itself was clean and spacious, with a lovely warmth as well. It had a real art deco theme with warm colors and light. The bed was comfy, and the bathroom was great, with a shower and bath. We came home every night, after a long day, with our room and bed clean and fresh. The hotel itself is only a few short steps away from the nearest subway station, which from there, can get you anywhere in the city in only a few minutes, and we were only a 10 minute walk to Times Square, or beautiful Bryant Park. Herald Square is just across the street, and food and coffee available everywhere. The free breakfast every morning was a great way to start the day, with everything you could want, when you're in a busy city. The building itself is old, which is great, 'cause so is New York, but it is very well maintained, with a very nice lobby. Finally, the staff there were what made our trip so special. They wanted to help in any way they could, whenever they could, and really looked after us. We felt like part of the family, and felt like we were part of New York, not just outsiders, looking in. A big thank you to all the staff at the front desk, who made us feel welcome every morning, and every evening when we came back home, especially Matthew, who treated us like a true friend from the moment we arrived. We feel like it's home whenever we think of New York, because of the Comfort Inn, Manhattan, and are planning on coming back next year, with my Mum as well, knowing that we'll all be looked after, like family. It's no exaggeration to say that it was the best experience of our lives ....... Thank You Sean & Vanessa

Reviews.Title: “Close to Macys”
Reviews.Author: Andrea186315
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and although a small hotel rooms are comfortable and have a mircowave and even a large fridge in the room to help if you need cold water stored on very warm days, Has a restaurant next door with an ajourning door to have breadfast and as a guest you are given discount if you eat there which is very handy especially if its raining outside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KarenEP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for Time Square, Empire State building & Macy's. The bedroom we had was very spacious but the bathroom was quite small BUT both bigger than any London City Centre Hotel we have stayed in. This was my first visit to NYC but my husbands 2nd and we both were very impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SK1960
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, stayed there on a company business trip. Good locationa dnq uite good service. I recommend this hotel. Will stay in this hotel again on my next trip. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Staff 5 stars !”
Reviews.Author: 33brooklyn
Reviews.Content: My name is Donna Contreras. My husband and I recently stayed at the above facility., 9-26 thru 9-29. The room was neat as well as other areas of the hotel. My hat's off to the 4 fantastic, fabulous people with whom we interacted during our stay. Milady, Victor, Brian and Matthew are the greatest. Warm, helpful and friendly. I was in a managerial position for over 12 years and I would hire them in a heartbeat. The hotel itself is great but it is these 4 who would bring me back to this Comfort Inn. I applaud them for their work ethic and I hope that they are appreciated by those who are over them. Sincerely, Donna Contreras DLC0524

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan c
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel, very clean, rooms are a very good size and the staff are very helpful would recommed this hotel to anyone infact i will be staying there again next year. Also the location is amazing 2 min walk to Macy`s about 10 min walk to Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: 186402Jane
Reviews.Content: I guess the location of this hotel is good - fairly central, which was useful when doing the sights with our teenage children. Personally I would prefer to slightly further away from the centre but the noise was not an issue once in the hotel. I would echo a previous review - Rooms aren't great and shower was awful. Temperature fluctuated all the time. We had booked 2 non-smoking rooms but clearly someone had been smoking heavily in one of them. The staff were not particularly friendly on arrival but more so on departure. Think this was in order to ensure a tip. Spoilt somewhat by the fact that when our limo (organised through Virgin) didn't turn up on time, whilst the bell man was helpful, he and the limo driver nearly ended up fighting while my husband loaded our bags! This was our last memory of NYC and the Comfort Inn. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you are happy to have a (reasonably) cheap but shabby room for the night, in a central location. Staff were nice enough especially when organising transport to the airport. If they had decent showers I'd recommend totally as the room decor is less important, however, with what we got as a shower in our room I'd current say no.

Reviews.Title: “Generally grubby and poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: Claire p
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was struck by how grubby the room was, there were hairs in the bed and around the bath. The shower, basin and toilet were stained and coated in lime scale. There were bags of rubbish in the hallway outside our room when we arrived which were still there the next day, over 12 hours later, making the hall smell awful. Add to this the cockroach I stepped on in the dark during the night and found dead by the bed the next morning and it doesn't really make for a very comfortable stay. The continental breakfast consisted of stale bagels and mouldy oranges. The location is good though and the staff were helpful. If you have the choice stay elsewhere, but if you've already booked here I'd advise taking cleaning products and scented candles to make your stay more tolerable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shabby decor, awful shower.”
Reviews.Author: weephil76
Reviews.Content: Best things about this hotel are the breakfast and the location. Breakfast is continental which in America is refreshing. Location is along from Macy's, next to empire state and just off 5th avenue. Great really. Staff were nice enough especially when organising transport to the airport. Rooms aren't great, clean enough but looks like a 200 a day smoker had been in one we got. Shower was awful. Had to adjust hot and cold to get the right temperature which was aful and even then it would fluctuate between freezing and scalding. Really not good enough. If they had decent showers I'd recommend totally as the room decor is less important, however, with what we got as a shower in our room I'd current say no.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: m_marlee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 11 nights. We booked 6 months prior, and asked for a view, fridge and microwave. We got the best room in the hotel, top floor right at the back with perfect view of the empire state building. Room is on the small side, but it is sufficient for the both of us. Bed was comfortable, room and bathroom was clean. Breakfast was basic but a bonus and saved us having to buy elsewhere. It includes, cereal, toast, bagels, donuts, waffles etc. The only problem we faced was when one of the lifts was out of service, so it can be time consuming waiting for a lift, especially when we were on the 12th floor. Only once i walked all the way down the stairs, which wasn't difficult. However my husband refuses to do so. Very good value for a perfect location. 10-15 min walk to times square, 2 min walk to herald square subway, 3 min walk to macy's and empire state building. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just o.k....”
Reviews.Author: Crafttrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple nights last week. We were coming in on a train at Penn Station, and having read several reviews, we decided this would be a good spot for us. If you're looking for "good location" as in "proximity to some popular sights" (Empire State Building, Macy's), then yes....it is also within reasonable walking distance to Times Square and is very close to a Subway station. However, the actual neighborhood surrounding the hotel surprised me a little, because just a few blocks over is a much cleaner and nicer area. Since we had small children with us, we probably would have chosen a little differently, had we known. I did not mind the age of the hotel - it's a little older but not gross. I also didn't mind the size of our room - with 3 adults, a preschooler, and a crib, we fit fine and did not feel cramped. However, I read over and over how "clean" other reviewers found the hotel to be. We did not have that same experience. When I pulled back the top blankets on both beds, there were long black hairs on the bed, and we also found several in the bathroom. I thought perhaps those had come from the cleaning person, but we passed her in the hall, and her hair was quite the opposite! There were other little things, like dirt inside the toilet bowl and on the bathtub ledge - I don't do a white glove test or anything, but it was stuff that could easily have been wiped off. Overall, we would chose a different spot on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cheery, clean, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: hatter08
Reviews.Content: Its hard to review this place as I donâ€™t know what else you can get for $300 per night over a busy September in NYC, but this place is what I ended up booking. We took a room on the 2nd floor as it was the only one available for our very early check in, and we were happy enough there to stay the whole 6 nights. The rooms are small but the bed was big and conformable. The windows were rather dirty on the outside and, being surrounded by tall buildings, our 2nd floor room didnâ€™t get much light or fresh air, but I wasnâ€™t exactly planning on spending my days in my hotel room. The building is really old (antique mail shoot old) so the place has a bit of character (like the ancient elevator) and the halls are a bit musty and in need of refurbishment, but the rooms are clean and nicely decorated with dark wood furnishings, cheery yellow striped wallpaper and flat screen tvs. Bathrooms are predictably pokey but still functional. We hardly heard our neighbours, but had a bit of noise from the street outside as there was construction going on. With the air conditioner on it didnâ€™t bother us. The location of this hotel is right in the middle of the touristy mid town area â€“ which is good for getting around â€“ the Empire State building and Macys are practically next door. The herald square subway station is at the end of the block and it has major connections to just about everywhere. There are 2 Duane Reedâ€™s (drug/convenience store) within a blockâ€™s walk which are good for drinks & snacks. We didnâ€™t try the hotelâ€™s restaurant but it was always buzzing. We did try the Korean BBQ place across the road which was pretty good, but a bit pricey. We also tried the Chinese place across the street which was decent and very cheap . There is also a slice away, hot dog place, Starbucks, Subway and Chipolates (good mexican) all within a blockâ€™s walk if you donâ€™t want to go far for a quick and inexpensive bite. Breakfast was mostly over processed carbs â€“ bagels, sliced bread, wafflels, donuts, cereal, muffins and some boiled eggs, cream cheese, jam etc. The coffee and orange juice however were good. Breakfast is irritatingly served on plastic plates with plastic cutlery (despite this being a proper restaurant at night?) â€“ but that seems to be the breakfast norm in most chain places we stayed in the US. I would advise getting to breakfast early as by 8.30am one had to wait for a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OliviaB544
Reviews.Content: Vacationed here a few years back in March 2008 with my school. The location for the money can't be beat and in general the look of the hotel is quite clean and nicely decorated. There is a lot of street noise coming into the hotel rooms and I found troubles sleeping at night but it is probably a New York thing and any hotel is going to have the noise. Our rooms were very small and dark, in fact the entire hotel is quite narrow with little to no windows but being in this great location I can almost guarantee you will not be spending enough time here to notice. It's definitely not a dream hotel but it's a nice hotel. Overall I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Shabby”
Reviews.Author: SussexWomble
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Virgin. On arrival, lobby is clean and tidy, and staff efficient and helpful. However, once you move from this area things change quickly. The lift is small and dated, and this applies to everything else. The staircases and hallways are tatty and very shabby.The two rooms we booked as a family were both drab and depressing, and everything in them, whilst clean, seemed to date from the 1950s. They both stank of cigarette smoke, although this dispersed when we switched on the antique - looking air conditioning. The bathroom cubicles were tiny and cramped, and difficult to move around in. The breakfast was basic and generous, but very competitive with the other guests, and the paper plates and bendy plastic cutlery were as cheap as possible. Despite the great location, there must be many better value hotels both in the area, and within an easy walk. Don't waste your money on this hotel until they spend some money on updating and improving it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: bcyankee24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights Aug 30- Sept 4. The location was great close to shopping and most of all the subway is only down the street. The room we had, had 2 beds and a real good size bathroom. My only issue was there breakfast. It had to be one of the worst I have had. Other than that the Hotel and the staff were all great. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre M
Reviews.Content: It's our second time in this hotel. The staff is great and helpful! it's very clean and the breakfast is good. The location is awsome! I would recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Set Your Expectations Accordingly”
Reviews.Author: BlackBadger79
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Manhattan is sold on two main attributes - price and location. Certainly this hotel's location is excellent, just a few minutes from the Empire State and a few minutes more to Time Square - all easily navigated on foot. As an 'affordable' hotel the question is less whether it delivers quality, but rather whether it represents value for money on it's own terms. On this criteria the results are mixed. There's no coffee making facilities in rooms, but this isn't uncommon for New York and free tea and coffee is available in reception throughout. Likewise the inclusion of breakfast is a nice touch, with a fairly reasonable range of cereals, fruits, toast and cakes. However... the hotel feels small, to the point of claustrophobia. Rooms themselves are clean but small. The stairs are steep to say the least and a 10 flight climb is likely to test the average Joe. Two small lifts serve the many floors, struggling to cope with demand at the best of times - let alone like during our stay when one failed and remained unprepared for the rest of the week. These aren't luxuries, these are the basics. Likewise paper plates and plastic cutlery for breakfast remove any sense of class from the establishment (whilst doubtless keeping costs, and therefore prices, down) and we found the reception service to be fairly slow and helpful as the exception rather than the norm. Given it's location and price the Comfort Inn may be worth a look. Provided you go in braced for relatively cramped conditions and don't expect gold standard service, you might find there's enough about the place to justify your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMG63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 8/9/11-14/9/11. Hotel is in an excellent location, it is a bit dated but for me this adds to the character. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We didn't have a good view from the window, but this did not bother us as we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel looking out of the window. We had two double beds for three of us, and this was perfectly adequate, though may have been a bit of a squeeze for four people. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was an added bonus. We got hotel staff to order us a cab to the airport after trying to flag down a taxi for some time, unsuccessfully(was 4pm a very busy time of day). Cab cost $61to JFK and came within ten minutes of ordering it, so between the three of us, it wasn't much more expensive than the taxi would have been. Will definitely be staying here again if I get the same excellent rate, really was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location , Location , Location”
Reviews.Author: SandyMonaghan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about location , everywhere within walking distance, no need to use public transport except to go to the outlets. Basic comfortable hotel with complimentary breakfast a real bonus as when you leave the hotel you are ready to go.. Rooms basic as in most standard affordable New York accommodation. Very suitable if the purpose is to visit the city that has everything to offer ie sight seeing and most importantly shopping.. Its a clean bed in a very central location to fall into after a busy day. Al in other reviews close to Maceys, Empire State Building etc. Also great selection of local bars which do evening meals at reasonable prices, so you can leave back the shopping bags and literally cross the road to eat good food at reasonable price. Have been in NYC on numerous occassions and can safely say it is the most convenient location i have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Kat82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend (9/10-9/12) and found this to be a great location and a good value. Free wifi with good and fairly easy access in the rooms. The breakfast was good with a selection of cereal, fruit, bagels, hardboiled eggs, donuts, muffins, etc. Coffee, decaf & hot water for tea are available in the lobby 24/7. Our room was quite small, but fine for 2 people. Our room was in the back and you could see the Empire State Building out the window. It was quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for sightseeing would stay again.Great City!”
Reviews.Author: tandjam
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New York stayed at this hotel with my son. Its perfectly located for getting about.Main attractions plus subway and tour buses all a within a short walk Room has everything we needed, fridge and microwave, air conditioning.Beds comfy, No complaints.
