My son loved the breakfast ,as many doughnuts and muffins as you want- as well as toast, bagels, cereal and fruit and a choice of drinks.All fresh.You can help yourself to coffee and tea from the machine in lobby also cold drinks machines and ice dispensers on floors.The staff were friendly and helpful. The Hotel is a great base for a sightseeing trip.Would return to New York and this hotel. We had a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on the Cleaning Staff”
Reviews.Author: Keyla24k
Reviews.Content: I book this Hotel at the last minute. The Hotel is in great location and area, the staff was friendly, room size was good and the bed too, but the SMELL was HORRIBLE, the bathroom smell very bad like an old molding mop very nasty, hairs hanging from the wall and all over the bathroom floor. I had go to the pharmacy across the street to buy a canddle and bathroom spray. But then the rest was just OK, also the price. The cleaning people should do a better job cleaning this nice Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Bourbonbot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 4 night NY trip. Its in an excellent location for everything With excellent subway connections and only 8 minutes walk from penn station. Macys is on one corner with the empire state on the other end. The room was clean and tidy and hardly any street noise and the staff were really friendly and helpfull too. Breakfast was nothing to write home about but it was adequate for a start to the day and free compared to other hotels for the same money. Brendans bar and resturant next door is nice for relaxing in after a busy day with a nice relaxed atmosphere. I would definately stay here again when i go back to the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, not sure of repeat!”
Reviews.Author: pratimagoel
Reviews.Content: Comfort inn was comfortable- actually my daughter has been staying in this chain before and always praised it. The rooms was little small but comfortable, clean. No view. And no refrigerator! It was quite warm and we needed to cool some food items..although ice was available on ground floor, it was not very convenient. Also..we booked a room for double occupancy and they gave us Twin Beds- it was quite obvious we are a couple..so that was little strange. I did request the reception for a change but was told it is not possible. Maybe they need to check this in future when they book in couples! A gym room would have been very appreciated, as we were stuck in the room for nearly 2 days because of hurricane Irene, and a small room with some fitness equipment would have helped in terms of health and time! Otherwise, staff was friendly, location excellent as we could walk easily to Little Italy and Chinatown. The subway was 5 minutes walk. On the whole, worth the money totally!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JITENDERhotelclassic
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel basic kind but with good location. It had basic breakfast. We booked this hotel as we wanted to stay very near to Time Square and Shopping Area. We can recommend this hotel to person having same choice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maryCoKildareIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed during hurricane Irene and were very well looked after. Great location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Only downside was the window looked onto a brick wall and air con was noisy. But we will definitely go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, hotel staff very friendly, would fully recommend”
Reviews.Author: Phil C
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to NYC. Stayed during Hurricane Irene (unfortunately!). Room quiet and had view of Empire state building. (ask for room in back of hotel - front of hotel will give you view of street - not much to look at) Well cleaned (cleaned daily) and well looked after (bathrooms could be a little more up to date but still in good condition). Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Would go out of way to help you. Free wifi which was much appreciated as we were able to keep an eye on the flight situation during the hurricane. Breakfast is continental so you know what to expect but has good choice. Dinner in restaraunt is good value (no more expensive than eating in Times square) Very centrally located to all attractions (1 block from Empire state (1min walk), 5mins walk to Times square & Broadway, 5~7mins walk from grand central station, library, rockefeller centre. Central park / 5th avenue approx 10~15min walk. Liberty Island/Wall street/Ground zero located in lower manhattan and is approx 1.5hrs walk (3miles). Felt very safe in area. Would 100% recommend and will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Cyndy H
Reviews.Content: I came in to the city my family was staying here and hurricane Irene was a threat. The staff was amazing and the management kept us informed and updated at all times! The rooms are immaculate and has a European . Due to the hurricane most shops were closed..but 5th avenue has tons of shopping...and bonus is that it is within walking distance to the theater! A MUST stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - very central - helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Margatetravellers945
Reviews.Content: Had a great week at the Comfort Inn Manhattan. Breakfast was a bit disappointing and there was a lack of space to sit but it was free! The restaurant was good value in the evening though. Matthew the Bellboy was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “"great value and so friendly"”
Reviews.Author: soccersuzi
Reviews.Content: if you want to be in the action part of the city that never sleeps this is the place for you. 2 blocks from the Empire State and 1 block from Macy's you can't be more central. Fifth Avenue is 100 yards away. My 18 year old son delighted himself every morning with a run round the main streets of New York.One day turn left and run to Central park and the next day turn right and run to Little Italy.He will never forget the sights. My wife headed for Macy's and my 22 year old daughter headed for Tiffanys. i took the pitifull remnants of my wallet to one of the many(and i mean many) bars within 200 yards of the hotel. the hotel itself has a very well stocked Irish bar attatched to it. The Waldorf Astoria this hotel is not but then it doesn't pretend to be so. In a city that sells its hotel rooms by the inch you get more than you pay for in this hotel. A very adequate sized bedroom and a more than sufficient sized bathroom stocked with all the free personal things you expect but don't always get(soap,shampoo etc). Continental breakfast is included in the price.I considered this a free extra because quite simply it has no need to offer this facility free in a city where most hotels charge. Bagels,toast,donuts,cereals,fruit,cheese all for free and for a little extra you can buy a hot cooked breakfast. i love a hotel that gives you the choice. Wi fi in the room for free and a community computer for free in reception. Reception always staffed by willing and friendly and helpful staff. if you want a slave to drag your cases to your room and you want silver service waiter service to serve you five star food then don't stay here.pay double somewhere else and enjoy yourself. if you want honest to goodness value for money in the heart of the Big Apple then this place is a must provided they have room for you. You couldn't have a better base to have a touristy family holiday in New York Appeared very busy when we stayed

Reviews.Title: “Good priced hotel in the middle of the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: SQFlyer72
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Comfort Inn Manhattan for 7 nights during my first visit to New York. The location of the hotel is great, on 35th street between fifth and sixth avenue, with lots of different restaurants and supermarket/pharmacy around. The 34th street/herald square subway station is just around the corner, making train travel to other parts of the city very convenient. The double room that i was allocated was clean and spacious with airconditioning (essential during the summer days in New York) and basic toilet amenities. However, the lighting was not great and the room could be dark in certain corner. Breakfast was included in the room rate and was served in buffet style with coffee/tea/juices, cereals, bagels/bread/donuts/muffins and apple/orange. Hot cooked breakfast was available at additional cost. A free pc with internet and printer was available for guest use in the lobby together with free coffee/tea self service machine too. Drink vending machine and ice were available in the stairways between certain floors. The two lifts in the hotel was quite old and slow and one of them broke down during some days of my stay. It would also be good to have a refrigerator in the room. Overall, i had a good stay in the hotel during my visit, the price was good with respect to its location and i would be stay here again if i come back to New York the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy room in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Leyly
Reviews.Content: I booked a double bed room for 4 adults. The room was cosy with a luggage closet and a decent size bathroom. Though quite small for the 4 of us, we managed to get around without bumping into each other. I enjoyed the buffet breakfast and free coffee and tea facility. The front desk staff were helpful and the bell boys were friendly. Best of all was the great location as Macy's and many other great shops and street food vendors were all nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best!”
Reviews.Author: sibby777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of our first-year anniversary trip to America and I have to say I was not really impressed. The best things about this hotel are the location (right in the centre near Macy's), free wifi and maybe the bed which is huge (like in most American hotels really!). The hotel is dated, the rooms are dark and lighting is dingy. The bathrooms are old and did not seem clean - there was a layer of grime on the tissue box! Also on the second day we found a half-eaten hamburger in the corner of the room under the curtains, yuk! The 'free' breakfast is appalling - plastic cutlery, polystyrene bowls and paper plates. Service is not existent! Felt like we were staying in a youth hostel, not a three star hotel in the centre of Manhattan! Would love to come back to NYC as we loved it, but would not stay here again. We complained to Virgin Holidays but they weren't interested! They obviously rely on tourists and not repeat business!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!”
Reviews.Author: troublekerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in january the city was coverd in snow it was just perfect!! Ideal location for all the top attractions most in walking distance such as central park ,times square and empire state building more importantly excellent for shopping!!!! simple hotel but excellent as a base really helpfull staff and always happy.Breakfast included and free tea and coffee 24 hrs would i stay here again? yes i would!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hgkoning
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, friendly personnel, good location, near the Empire State Building (just around the corner). Breakfast was also good. We had a double-bedroom (3 persons). We had a room in a corner, so we didn't have much light. Beside that, the room was ok. Plain, but neat. Every day change of towels. The beds were good, bathroom also. When At the end of the street you find Macy's en lots of other shops. Metro also nearby. We had a pleasant stay here!

Reviews.Title: “My home base in Manhattan: Great location for CUNY Grad School and Empire State Bldg”
Reviews.Author: AlanColumbus_OH_USA
Reviews.Content: Rooms a little small, but not bad for Manhattan. Breakfast is pretty good (bagels, boiled eggs, coffee, juice, milk) but you need to pay for hot breakfast. Very quiet rooms. I love the old U.S. Mail slots on each floor. As for e-mail, wireless internet is very reliable and fast. Easy walk to most major subway lines, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Macy's, Empire State Building, Herald Square, CUNY Graduate Center, New York Public Library, and the Morgan Library. 35th st. itself is a little dark and very few businesses, but 34th street is bustling and has everything you really need. Broadway is also nearby, and Times Square is only a 10 minute walk away. The hotel has a bar that is very nice and quiet, compared to the too-loud Irish "Playwright Bar" across the street (although the Playwright has a great breakfast, and a discount for Comfort Inn patrons--get the coupon at the front desk before you go). The somewhat rare NYC subway map is available at the front desk (I had to beg for one from the concierge at the Holiday Inn on 57th my last stay in NYC).

Reviews.Title: “One good thing, location”
Reviews.Author: Swimmer21
Reviews.Content: Cracked sink, hairs in the bed, dust everywhere need I go on. Throughly disgusting hotel that nearly ruined holiday but luckily 6 hours after arriving virgin holidays moved across the road to the hotel metro. If you want to enjoy New York then DON'T STAY AT THIS DUMP!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherwoodxxl
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel, on 35th between Macy's and the Empire State Building. We had 2 rooms for 5 days. Small as one would expect in New York. And in a need for refurbishment even if the bathroom was very decent. The 2 rooms had a strong smell, cigarette for one, unknown for the second. The main issue for us was the very intrusive housekeeping ladies, on duties and knocking the doors from 8 am ! Another issue was around the elevators, only 2, small and slow. A big issue when on the 10th floor ! Free wifi in the room, very noisy air conditioning. We had to pay a small charge for the deposit safe in the room. A positive surprise was the free breakfast, though the choice was so limited and quality average that we only took it once in the hotel. Overall not super convinced by the experience....

Reviews.Title: “In the beating heart of the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: LellaSS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the centre of the City that " never sleeps", just a few blocks away from Times Sq and 300m from the Empire State Building . The building itself would need to undergo refurbishing, the rooms are small and so are the bathrooms. We requested a refrigerator to be put in the room ( as advertised on the hotel's website) three times, but never got one. It was so hot those days, it'd have been beyond useful to have cold water in the room to hydrate. The complimentary buffet breakfast was average ( I personally found the bagels not very fresh and the eggs had a funny taste). On the whole i would recommend this hotel and would go back again. On the whole

Reviews.Title: “Everything included!”
Reviews.Author: islabonita
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel back in March for our July trip for 4 nights through booking.com. I got a great price in comparison to the other hotels for 3 adults with so many amenities included. We had a room with 2 double beds which in the end did not turn out to be the most comfortable for us but for 2 people it would be great. Lots of pillows, comfy and clean bed with protector cases for the mattress. Counter table, desk and dresser along one wall with a flat screen. Night table with ample lighting and alarm clock. Closet with a safe ( fee) and ample room in the bathroom. Only thing we didn't like was the shower pressure of hot and cold shifting on it's own. Room for improvement would be to have better ventilation in their elevators.. felt like a sauna in there. The pros outweighed the cons such as :free daily breakfast just like it's pictured on their website: coffee, juices, cereals ( 3 kinds) donughts, bagels, sliced bread to toast, boiled eggs and waffle. The area was kept clean and filled continuously by their hard working staff. Free internet and daily newspapers. We stayed on the 12th floor facing the front without a view to speak of. We had a small frig and microwave which we put to good use. The lobby was clean and cool with AC and had several couches to sit at , enjoy complimentary coffee all day, free daily newspapers and pc use. The staff was very friendly and courteous at all times and responded lighting fast to my request of a new shower curtain since the one there had a musty smell and within minutes they were there to replace it and that took care of the funky smell. The airconditioner ran continually which I loved since usually the click on and off of most wake me up easily. The location can't be beat , steps away from Broadway , Herald Square, a subway ,round the corner for bus pick up and 5th avenue going east for shopping. ESB within 2 blocks . Restaurants ,pubs and a bakery within the same block W 35th street. Discount for 2 restaurants were included. Check out is at noon but if you have to stay longer due to your transportation they will tag your belongings and keep it in a locked area next to the entrance area for free. We even returned a couple of hours before leaving to relax in their lobby , have coffee, watch tv and using the pc before getting our taxi to meet our bus. Overall I give the CIM very high marks and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value”
Reviews.Author: Showstopper101
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a 3 night holiday. This was my first time ever in New York and I was staying on the ninth floor with an empire state building view. The room was great hd tv, clean, warm, good bathroom, nice and quiet. Staff were very helpful in showing me the way to landmarks. Overall great stay. Definitely come back !!

Reviews.Title: “Even better than last time!”
Reviews.Author: JPX2
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Comfort Inn and this stay was as good as the first. Warm welcome from the staff - we requested a different room and this wasn't a problem at all. Asked for fridge, no charge, and it was installed within about 10 minutes of arriving. The breakfast is an added bonus. Perfect location with Times Square about 10 minutes walk away. Worked out the Subway system and bought a 7 day ticket for about Â£20. With a subway stop at the end of the street there was no stopping us! Certainly use the Comfort Inn in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good location well price”
Reviews.Author: juliejf
Reviews.Content: this is perfectly located and well price noting to complain. If I go back to NYC I would stay dthere again. it<s a little bit rustic but for the price you are not even a block away from Macy<s and the empire state building.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: vegaschick
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before a cruise and 4 nights when we returned. The hotel was a great base for sightseeing and shopping! The front desk was helpful and the free breakfast and all day coffee & tea very welcome. Free internet connection in the room too was very handy. The room was clean and had everything we needed. We used the menu in the room for a delivery dinner a couple of nights and would highly recommened it! Cheaper than a restaurant and great when you are shattered from sightseeing - food and beer watching trashy TV!! We bought a few soft drinks at Dwayne Reade round the corner and saved a but there too. Would stay again on next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and staff were great!”
Reviews.Author: Jtbeavers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights. Location in Midtown was perfect. The restaurant food was delicious, and the bar was fun. Matthew and Gulbye at the front desk were so helpful and nice!!! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “C, C, C - Convenient, Clean, Courteous”
Reviews.Author: Agriffith789
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions and continue to return. The Comfort Inn is convenient to everything there is to do in the City and for NYC it is extremely clean. Last but not least....Courteous...the staff is extremely courteous which you won't find in all the hotels in NYC. Some of the rooms are a little small, however, they are very nicely decorated, extremely clean and well taken care of. Regardless of the size, remember where you are...NYC....who spends a lot of time in there room anyway. If heading to NYC and you want a comfortable, clean hotel room without takikng out a second mortgage to pay for the room....stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel for few days stay.”
Reviews.Author: Admw_uk
Reviews.Content: Was a good little hotel for our 5 day trip. Room lovely, clean with great room, safe and bathroom. Windows were sealed shut and in 80oF weather AC was always on. Bed was very comfortable. Free breakfast in held in adjoining restaurant, just a buffet of waffles/bagels/muffins/cereals, can get very busy as only a few tables. Staff were lovely, very helpful helpinh us book transport back to airport and checking bags after checkpoint until flight later at night. Would definitely recommend, in great location very near Empire State, Macy's and 10 min walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kals1060
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here end May/beginning June 2011 and loved it. Our 10th floor room was really nice and we could see the Empire State Building from our window. Talk about the wow factor! The staff were really nice, friendly and helpful. Decent breaktasts, ate at Brendan's bar two nights. Perfect location for walking to all "the" places to visit - Times Sq, Broadway, Macy's, 5th Ave, Rockefella Centre with Central Park about 21 blocks away. Subway nearby for short ride down to see Liberty. Would definitely visit this hotel again and of course New York. Fabulous city with fabulous people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service on 35th Street”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Ian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently took a holiday cruise from New York to Bermuda to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We stayed at the Comfort Inn on 35th Street for 2 nights before the cruise. We were greeted in a professional and friendly manner on arrival and our room was spacious and comfortable. The hotel is situated on 35th Street which made it very easy to walk the few blocks to Time's Square, Macey's and the Empire State Building. There were two highlights to our stay, the first being the wonderful cooked American breakfast which was delicious, great value for money and served with a friendly smile. The second was the excellent customer service we received from the concierge Matt. I am an international business customer care trainer and my wife run's her own Hotel Booking Agency and so we both have extensive experience of standards in hotels. We both agreed that Matt's attention to detail, knowledge, understanding and quick response to our needs was exceptional and over and above our expectation. After our cruise a week later, we returned to the Comfort Inn for help with options for getting to JFK. Matt remembered my name, assisted us with invaluable information to ensure we arrived at the airport safely and on time and then looked after our luggage allowing us a few more hours to explore New York before heading back to the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jaseraw
Reviews.Content: Excellent location around the corner from Macy's and a few blocks from time square. Very comfortable beds and great breakfast. would definatley return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff !!!!”
Reviews.Author: peitraveller21
Reviews.Content: Great hotel good size rooms for a downtown NYC hotel. Great location can walk to everything!! Large selection for complimentary breakfast buffet. Restaurant next door has great food!! Have stayed at this hotel three times over the last 5 years. The conceriege Matthew was great!! super helpful and always had a smile on his face ;)

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to local fun”
Reviews.Author: RPrehn
Reviews.Content: The staff was so helpful and attentive. The only real issue we have is that the mirror is placed too high up in the bathroom and there isn't much room for toiletries. The room is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have stayed in for ages!”
Reviews.Author: nikkiespi
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic value for money with excellent staff and clean and comfortable rooms. The beds are incredibly comfy, & considering it is in the middle of Manhattan there was hardly any noise! We had a lovely room up on the 12th floor with gorgeous views of surrounding area. Our room had a safe, fridge and microwave in it which was fantastic as we were travelling with a 4 year old and a 5 month old. Location was AMAZING it was about a 2 minute walk away from Macys and the empire state building and was on the corner of 5th avenue, was also only 5-10 min walk away from Times Square as well so you can get to loads of sites from here so quickly! The adjoining restaurant 'Brendans Bar and Restaurant' is fantastic, I had the nicest cheeseburger here for only 12 or 13 dollars and the restaurant is beautiful. The night we got there we got talking to the waitresses in there and told them it was our 1st time in NYC and they were talking to my 4 year old son and at the end of the night they bought out a cheesecake with NYC in sauce & a candle in it to 'celebrate our visit' for my son free of charge! You could not get better staff or service and the food is to die for, especially the cheesecake! The staff at the front desk at the Comfort inn were also fantastic and remembered our names and were always talking to my son and even played cars with him when it wasnt busy! You also get free wifi if you ask for the code at the front desk. Im sure if you paid through the nose you could find a posher hotel with good service but if you are looking for value for money in a quaint pretty hotel with a lovely family feel to it in an excellent location- look no further than the comfort inn manhattan! Can not recommend enough!

Reviews.Title: “central location for 1st timers”
Reviews.Author: anysalads
Reviews.Content: Prime location for 1st timers. room 704 did have a strong smell of urine not good. All staff were friendly and welcoming. The front of the hotel is very noisy with the traffic all throughout the night. Continental breakfast needs to have a bit more of a varity and less cakes maybe ham and hard cheese. i did encounter 3 big bites on my arm on the 5th night of being here could be bed bugs not sure. Probably try some where else next time, it was good for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and the friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: texastonc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to do some sightseeing in New York. It was close to many attractions, along with being right by a subway stop! The staff was so friendly. The room was clean and the breakfast was good for a continental. It is important to ask for a non smoking room if this is what you want!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: hmurtagh
Reviews.Content: Does what it says on the tin - comfort. No hassle , friendly and helpfull staff, continental breakfast very good . The Fresh bagels set us up for the day very filling. 3 min walk from Macys and a whole host of other shops. 2 min walk from herald square subway. We bought a week long metro card costs around Â£24 each and you travel all week on all the subways and the buses. Had no trouble with either always regualar never waited more than 10 mins for either. Very cheap way of getting round and seeing the sights. Catch the subway down to the staten island ferry and ride it there and back - Its free and you sail right past the statue of liberty. Empire state building on the next street , we got up early had breakfast and shot round there at 8am when it opens no queues for us going in when we left around an hour later the queue was around the block, anyhow hoping every one enjoys their holiday. xx

Reviews.Title: “AB FAB”
Reviews.Author: Suzywoozy57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from last week and have a fabulous time. Hotel and staff were great. We stayed for 5 nights in a double double bed room. Beds were heaven to sleep in, room was great had table & chairs tv plenty of drawers and a walkin wardrobe. In the wardrobe was a safe (foc) and an iron and ironing board. Bathroom was big. The room was very clean and tidy (until we arrived). Appeared noisy on first night outside but didn't keep us awake. Breakfast was ok toast/bagels, cereals and apples/oranges. No facilities in room to make drinks but in reception there was a tea/coffee machine and you just helped yourself whenever you wanted. Brendans which is part of the hotel served lovely meals and reasonably priced. You can also get bar snacks at any time whilst open. Try the cheese & fruit plater. If you fancy a chinese meal there is one just across the road, we had lo mein 1 between 2 would have been enough they were huge portions. The 4 of us girls really enjoyed ourselves as usual when we go to NYC. Hope this feedback is a good insight for you. The Girls from Nottingham, England

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Roselin17
Reviews.Content: Good location-I could see the Empire State Building from the window of our room. Our queen room was a good size with a large cupboard for hanging clothes,a flat screen tv and a perfectly adequate bathroom. Breakfast was fine-cereal,bagels, donuts, waffles toast etc although it wasn't easy to find an available table.Staff were helpful. There's an underground station on the corner of the road,but I must say I didn't find the New York underground as easy to use as London or Paris.There didn't seem to be anyone around to ask for help or any signs. This wasn't too much of a problem though as we were able to walk most places such as Central Park, The Rockerfeller Centre,The Guggenheim.FAO Schwarz,Time Square and many more places.Our room was quite noisy at night. The hotel had a computer which was free to use and we were able to book in online and change our seats and print our boarding passes which was very useful

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: friend86
Reviews.Content: . The location is ideal within easy walking distance of many sights and attractions. Several snack bars nearby and 2 Irish pubs just across the road. On arrival reception staff were helpful and pleasant. We were provided with a map and further information during the visit . Also luggage storage facility on check out day which was really useful Room was a double double and of reasonable size, claen but dated in style and rather dimly lit . Lots of fresh towels provided daily . Staff in the breakfast room were not very friendly and paper cups, plates and plastic cutlery were a bit basic. Not very easy spreading hard butter on toast with a plastic knife on a paper plate!! On one occasion we were asked to leave the breakfast area as there was a queue ( Actually there wasn't) and as we had finished eating they needed the table.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SLSNottingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Comfort inn. Arrived into JFK and took the Airtrak to Jamacia Station, and then got the train to Penn Station. Took about 45 mins and was alot cheaper than a taxi. Approx $20 return each and then a short walk to the hotel. Hotel was in a great location, 2-3 mins walk from Empire State, 2-3mins from Macys and we walked into Times square and to 5th Avenue in about 10mins, though 5th Avenue is about 20 mins to get nearer central park and rockerfeller centre. There is a subway station at the end of the street so can always catch the subway. The free breakfast was just what you needed to start the day, pretty basic but more on offer if wanted to purchase. We travelled with Virgin and with the rep meeting, you got a choice of 4 cooked breakfasts which was also a nice treat. We all did mostly tourist sites, empire state, rockerfeller centre, Ellis island, Brooklyn bridge, Statue of Liberty etc and tried to walk everywhere. The greyline buses are a good alternative though and many of our friends have used. Be careful when booking trips with Virgin, we were sold empire state tickets which when we were asked he confirmed they were the same price as purchasing there and would assist with the queuing but this was not the case! They were $2 eachmore expensive and we still had to do exactly the same queuing and change the voucher into a ticket! Room was spacious, as we had read the rooms were all small in NY. Comfy bed, flatscreen TV, safe etc. Free tea and coffee in reception, and also free internet in 15 mins slots which was just enough to check emails etc. irish bar across the road was good for beer and food. Check for happy hour times and also bargain if the guy is out front, we managed to get a 20% voucher! Overall, would definately recommend this hotel and if we went back to NY, would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - made the weekend!”
Reviews.Author: dante35
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant. The location is the main thing - just perfect for getting to all the midtown sights and sounds. The room was perfectly adequate and very clean. Yes the bathroom was small but everything was clean and working and even had toiletries. Plenty of storage space and the room safe was a bonus as well. Nice breakfast to start the day and the Virgin hot breakfast on the first day was a bonus. Free tea and coffee in the lobby was great to grab as we headed out the door. The hairdryer didn't work when I tried it but within 10 minutes an engineer brought another one to our room. Great service all round. Free internet and printer was great to get our return boarding passes. But without a doubt the location makes this hotel 5* in my book. A five minute walk to the Empire State building (which was great as we went overboard in the giftshop so could drop them off afterwards!). Macy's was even closer and is open until 9.30pm every night. Times Square was 10 minutes away as was Grand Central Terminal. The subway was at the end of the street and 5th and 6th Avenue either end. It took us about 30 minutes to walk up to Central Park and 20 minutes to the Rockefeller Centre. Just perfect. Would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view of empire estate from bedroom window!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mil0011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum for Easter. We found the hotel to be pleasant, helpful and clean. Its a small friendly hotel with 12 floors situated in midtown manhattan. We were fortunate to get put on the 12th floor which had a view of the empire estate building!! The room was a good size and very clean, daily maid service. The bathroom was tiny but the room made it for that! On the first morning of breakfast you get greated by Virgin rep and served a lovely breakfast. The mornings after you have the complimentary breakfast which is great in the mornings as it saves having to find somewhere to eat. The breakfast consists of bagels, toast, dougnuts, cereal, coffee ,juice etc. Be early to avoid to avoid it from being busy! Their is a great choice of room service food which come from the cafe next door. we found this to be a bonus especially after all the sightseeing. Their hot choc is yummy. The hotel is situated next to a cafe and a Brendans bar/grill which both serve nice snacks and food which we found to be pleasant and near (after all the walking during the day) plus you get 15% off at brendans bar/grill if you stay at hotel. Hotel is situated on a quietish street up from Macy's and from Empire estate which is approx 2-3 min walk!!! We didn't find it to be too noisy at night at the hotel due to it being on a quietish side street!!! In the hotel lobby you get complimentary free coffee and tea all day long due to having no drink facility in your room. One thing i would mention is the hotel taxi service to be pricy, it ended up costing us about $81 dollars from hotel to JFK airport on way bk!! On the way going to hotel from JFK a yellow taxi cost us about $45 dollars.... so it might be worthwhile flagging down a yellow cab!!! Overall I would deffo stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, friendly staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jezendee
Reviews.Content: A four day trip to New York was greatly enjoyed with thanks to the staff at this hotel! Very close to the subway, walking distance to Macy's and fifth avenue. Hotel has well stocked bar, comfortable rooms and a good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: nat_xfiles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. Just around the corner from the Empire State Building and Macys. It is only about a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square and the centre of Fifth Avenue. The hotel provided excellent service. Contiental breakfast was provided free by the hotel and really sets you up for the day. As we had booked with Virgin Holidays we also received a free cooked breakfast on the first morning there. The hotel has free wi-fi and a computer in the lobby that you can use. Free newspapers are also available. I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Close to it all!”
Reviews.Author: mkemows
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to NYC, so really didn't know what to expect in selecting this or any other hotel. I knew I wasn't rich so did as much research as I could to find one that was reasonable. I truly was happy with this Comfort Inn. It was close to Penn Station which allowed me easy travel to JFK and EWR, and is very near Macys, Harold Square and The Empire State Building. Times Square was about 10-15 minute walk. The room were in very clean condition, updated with flatscreen TV's though reception of local stations was spotty at times. While my room faced 35th Street and there was some noice, I sleep with a fan on so didn't really bother me. Bathroom is small, but very clean and nice towel quality for a Comfort Inn. The rooms have nice touches. The staff was very helpful, allowing me to store my luggage as my room was not ready when I arrived. The free breakfast was ok, nothing special. But hey, it is a free breakfast to get one ready for all that walking and touring. Luxury, no...very comfortable though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resting Place in the Heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Nikki-Simon-Mills
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 7 nights at the beginning of March 2011 and we really did enjoy our stay! I've never been to New York City before so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised at how friendly and helpful the staff were, how comfortable the room was and how quiet it was inside the hotel! Breakfast was more than enough to get you started for a long day around the City .... waffles, boiled eggs, toast, English muffins, muffins, cereal ... eat until your hearts content! I particularly enjoyed peanut butter and jelly on toast, as weird as it might sound! My husband said that the dining area was a bit like being in a hostel .... kind of a relaxed atmosphere really, it is a small but they do open a door to another room with a further two tables inside. And if it's busy, there's always the computers you can go and use (for free) whilst you wait for a table. The bed was comfy, which is what you need after a busy day in the hustle and bustle. The only thing I found was they were quite high .... I'm 5ft 4 and would need hubby to bump me up onto the bed on some occasions as I simply couldn't get on ... mainly because I was suffering with my back from all the walking. The rooms were clean and the shower was quite powerful. We could see the Manhattan Bridge from our window. The location is great, felt like being in the middle of Hong Kong! Really easy to get around and you feel safe enough whilst walking around during the day and the evening. All in all, a really great stay and if we were to return to the Big Apple we would most definitely return to this little treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a central stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Pogles63
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay!!! We have just returned from our 4 night stay in the Comfort Inn-I was apprenhensive about our choice of hotel after reading the reviews-yet we all look for different things! I chose it for location, the relaxed style and the breakfast. We had a very comfy room, clean linen, towels replaced daily and plenty of them. Plenty of hot water for bath and shower. Tea and coffee facilities in the lobby- Breakfast was fine-I didn't want to be looking for somewhere to eat first thing in the morning-donuts, waffles cereals,toast, muffins plenty to set you on your way. Brendans is excellent for a meal -quite a transformation from the breakfast area in the morning. No trouble with noise(I had packed ear plugs just incase!!!) Take on board the age of the building and the fact you are there mainly to sleep! Computer in the lobby-very handy The Grays hop on hop off bus is a 'yes' Fabulous views from the Rockefleller Centre.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in NYC for $189/night - near everything!”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippin4ever
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing. The access to the subway and proximity to many of the sightseeing spots is great. We loved everything about this Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL, STAFF AND SERVICE.”
Reviews.Author: lancslads
Reviews.Content: We have just had four nights (19th March to 23rd March 2011) stay at the Comfort Inn, Manhattan, New York. We arrived early. was offfered tea & coffee and was told our room was ready by a very helpful and courteus front of house Staff. The hotel lobby is well maintained, clean, bright, well furnished, comfortable and full of very useful information for your stay in New York. our hotel was room was very impressive, Excellent facilites included room safe, bathroom including toiletries, and a very comfy bed. Upon looking out of our room window, we had a birds eye view of the Empire State Building and was a marvellous sight every morning. The room price included breakfast which included tea,coffee, cereals, toast, eggs, porridge, pastries of various varieties, cream cheese and various kinds of croissants, cakes and fresh fruit. we requested a fridge upon arrival and within 5 minutes a fridge was in our room and at no extra cost. All the hotel staff were polite, helpful, making sure everything was to our satisfaction at all times. We were very impressed with every aspect of our stay at the Comfort Inn and would definately stay there again next year, we would also reccomend this hotel for a wonderful stress free stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: queenofhearts12350
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to New York and having stayed at an amazing hotel beforehand I had high expectations... Upon arrival at the Comfort Inn, we were slightly disappointed as we had written to the hotel to request a view of the Empire State Building, but we had no view at all, just of some other roofs. However, the room was clean and very neat with a large flat screen TV, and we could pick up the free wi-fi easily from the room. The bathroom however was a different story. Room 911 had obviously not been used in a while as when the bath/shower tap was first switched on a lot of black stuff was coming out along with bright yellow water. The bath was filling slowly and it turned out the plug wasn't draining properly either... The following evening before we were going out, upon flushing the toilet the water was rising and rising and leaked over into the floor before we turned off our water and reported it to the reception staff. They said they would send somebody right away, however when we arrived back to the room very late that night they said unfortunately it could not be fixed that day and would be sorted first thing in the morning. So the next morning, we went out for the day and reminded the staff of our problem. Still not fixed by the time we got back to the room to get ready for our evening out. Finally, we returned home around 10pm and the toilet had been fixed. I am sure the hotel staff are very busy, however, I think more than 24 hours to fix a toilet is slightly ridiculous. We thought the breakfast was OK. For a hotel in Manhattan, I believe it is rare to offer breakfast at all, and saved us alot of money. We did eat out a couple of days but found the hotel breakfast fine for what we needed it for. The location of the hotel was just brilliant. Less than a 5 minute walk to Times Square, and you can be at Macy's or the Empire State Building in literally 1 minute. Overall, if you want to spend your NY money on shopping and site seeing, rather than on a plush hotel, the Comfort Inn is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for a 2-star!”
Reviews.Author: ShoppingM0M
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel makes up for some of its short-falls! Half a block from Macy's, 15 minute walk from Times Square, 5 minutes to Penn Station, 2 minutes to subway. It wasn't the cleanest place we've ever stayed, but it wasn't disgusting, either. It's an older place, and a little dusty (okay - and some mold in the shower), but the beds were very comfortable, the staff was friendly and the hot coffee available 24-hours a day in the lobby was a small slice of heaven. The breakfast was adequate to start the day. We did request adjoining rooms, and were told we would have them, only to be told on the day of check in that they weren't available. Kids stayed on the 5th floor, adults on the 6th. Kids chose to come up to our room to shower, as water pressure was so much better. Friends had warned me about the size of hotel rooms in NYC, but these were great in that aspect...didn't feel cramped at all. No sign of bedbugs anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic St Patricks celebration!”
Reviews.Author: cat1424
Reviews.Content: Just back from NYC with 3 friends and found this hotel ideal not only for location but the hotel front staff were so helpful and pleasant. Hotel was great and have no complaints - towels changed every day and room cleaned. Never had a problem with lifts. Breakfast was a bonus and could upgrade to the paid breakfast menu if you wanted - food in Brendans was fantastic and would recommend that you try it - pancakes in the cafe to the right of the hotel were also fab! Hotel staff were so pleasant and helpful - apologies again to Matt for breaking his scale and thanks again for organising the taxi to the airport and for your suggestions iro sightseeing - v helpful. Staff took the time to explain where to go and Macy's discount card etc - thankyou! Took a day to Jersey Gardens - bus from Port Authority on 42nd St - round trip was $13 and v easy to find booth,bus etc. Mall is fully covered and only 30mins away by bus so at this time of year a good investment if you like the shopping. Hop on Hop off bus tours were again great and offered an opportunity to take our time at the sights we had selected whilst giving us an opportunity to hear the history of NYC. Altogether a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for midtown”
Reviews.Author: pyatachok
Reviews.Content: This hotel has met our expectations. PROS: Great location (close to almost everything that worth seeing and a lot of transportation options). Quite clean (with the quality of their laundromat was better). Nice attentive service on the front desk. Good isolation of the rooms from each other (you still will hear the street noise, but not your neighbors), but street noise is unavoidable in the center of New York so bring your earplugs if you are a light sleeper. CONS: Absence of Microwave & refrigerator though the mini size of them could be placed on the top of some furniture in the room. Breakfast is VERY basic. We didn't bother to eat their food, but found a nice Korean bakery on 32th st (5 mins walk) and brought fresh yummy pastries and cressants to the hotel (eating them @ the bakery would cost us almost double the price of taking out :( ). the name of the bakery is Koryodang. Also the temperature and pressure of the water in the shower is very changeable while taking it, so be careful to adjust. Otherwise we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would warn everyone who is thinking of staying in this hotel. You are going to regret it!”
Reviews.Author: redfruit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our holiday in NYC and it's our first time in NYC. The review by some people are quite positive and I didn't investigate more into this hotel because it's a present for me. We arrived on Friday and we checked in at the front desk and the staff are ok. Not rude but also not friendly. They didn't even asks any question or say anything to make you feel welcome just the formal things like check out is 2pm and breakfast is at 8-10pm. So we headed into our room. The lift is so tiny that it's a bit tricky if you have a big luggage. The floors on the hall are all creaky and door noisy like the hotel was built during the First World War. We are on the 10th Floor and the door on our room won't even shut properly so at night a bit of light from the hall is seeping thru our door. Comes into our room it's tiny, dusty and dated. Bathroom was digusting not even got any heating on it so get quite cold when showering. It got two tap one for cold and one for hot so you've got to be good at mixing the water to get the right temperature. Shower is the same its not even electric shower. So you are showering and suddenly water gone either hot or cold. In the room the heating/airconditioned is behind the curtain "How stupid is that"? So can't close the curtain at night and in the morning u can't even open the curtain wide because the next building is an office so you will exposed yourself plus windows are quite smuggy,dusty and dirty. I would go back to NYC but I will swear never to saty in this hotel as I'm traumatised. Oh! and the breakfast is a cold bagels, cornflakes,coffee, orange juice they provided toaster probably 4 and you toast it yourself and cut the bagel by yourself. All in All if you want to have an enjoyable stay never ever stay in this hotel pay that little extra. There are loads of better hotel at the same price as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location basic but ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: shopaholicsister
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first visit to New York for his birthday in February, 2011 and travelled with Virgin. After the fast and erratic taxi trip to the hotel we arrived to be told our rooms werent ready and as reception is very small and there were a lot of people waiting we put our luggage into storage and went for a walk outside. After about an hour or so our rooms were ready and we settled in. Firstly the hotel is basic but you get what you pay for - their was a child behind reception when we checked in helping I guess his mother at work and generally lobby area is quite tatty and coffee machine area always was a bit messy. However the rooms are spacious and beds were very comfy and the rooms were cleaned every day with plenty of fresh towels in the bathroom. The bath did take a long while to run and was not very long but was deep and comfy. Rooms were quite warm but on the last day we found the heater by the window was also a cool fan! The hotel is so central for everywhere - Macys, Times Square and you can even walk to the Water for the River Boat Trips you really could walk most places from the hotel. We went to Woodbury Shopping Outlet (about an hour away by Bus) definately a must for the serious shoppers and also did the obligatory sight seeing bus trips downtown and uptown but never had time to go the Bronx. Empire State Building is 2 mins walk from the hotel and Rockerfella centre 10 or 15 - we went up one at night and one in the day the views were amazing on both! Brendans bar which is also where breakfast is held and joined on to the hotel is great in the evenings and gets quite a crowd in there great place for eat and drinks but as others have said the free breakfast is nothing special but fills a gap even if the coffee and juices are out of plastic cups and food served on paper plates and plastic knifes and forks. All in all a great trip basic hotel but far outweighed by the great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: KatRose_10
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location in NYC, its just up the road from Macy's and the Empire state building is just around the corner!! We got a yellow cab from the airport and we were greeted by a friendly male receptionist who gave us a map of the city and pointed out where a few things were and explained the times of breakfast etc etc - nice and easy. Went up to our room...can't remember exactly what number but it was on the 5th floor i think - we could see the empire state building from our window!!!! i was so happy! rooms are lovely - welcoming and just nice. ensute bathroom which was a bonus, the water from the shower was nice and hot and it was overall very clean. it was freezing when we went in January so thankfully we had a radiator and the air con had a heater in it too so it warmed up the room nicely. In room safe which was helpful to store everything...what else...nice comfy bed and a big tv! i got a bit addicted to american tv as they always played sex and the city and old school programmes like saved by the bell! also handy to keep an eye on the weather and how cold it was going to be! the only downfall to the room which isn't major at all was that our radiator clunked so badly when we turned it on - we couldn't sleep with it on else it would clunk all night! we weren't bothered though, we just put it down to the cold weather affecting it. the free breakfast is a god send! and it really fuels you up for the day ahead, you can eat as much as you want. from cereal, bagels, toast, and even doughnuts! if you book with Virgin you can get a free cooked breakfast with your welcome meeting, it was yummy :) pretty much a fry up but just nicer... mmm maple syrup on bacon!! the breakfast area is set in a bar called Brendan's Bar and Grill which is joined to the hotel, you can get to it from inside. they are open in the evening for bar food and drinks. across the road are a couple of irish pubs which are nice and friendly. but seriously, the location tops everything about this hotel - the subway, Herald Sq Station, is at the end of the road so easy access to anywhere. easy quick walk to times square - we walked absolutely everywhere (apart from when we went down to the bottom of manhattan) and when you get in at the end of the day you are so tired from walking, you won't really care where you sleep. but its just nice that this hotel feels safe, its warm and just nice!! plus you can have free coffee and tea all day at reception!! we would get one everyday when we came in from our day out, go up to our room and chill out before heading out at night. Well recommended. Also, you can hear the traffic at night, but its not as loud as what i expected. also the free wifi is handy when you want to research where to eat that night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location right in the middle of manhattan !!”
Reviews.Author: Mufc2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for location it's 1 block up from macys and in the next street to the empire state building a short walk to times square and a 10 min walk to central park plus the bonus of being next to the subway station to get down town. The hotel itself was fine we had no problems with cleanliness and the room we had was plenty big enough (room 701) a smallish bathroom but clean and good shower, the bed was a bit soft but other than that no problems at all, we will be returning at some point and would recommend it to anyone. Be careful if your getting a taxi from JFK airport you shouldn't pay anymore than $60, ( some fellas were trying to charge $95) so get a yellow cab. And the best meal we had was at planet Hollywood (times square) a bit of a wait but well worth it !!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok but stayed in better”
Reviews.Author: Buff_G
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned home after a 4 night stay in this hotel from Feb 23rd to Feb 27th. Whilst there we had a Few problems, when we entered our room it stunk of stale cigarette smoke so we aired it by opening a window. We are both non smokers and hate the smell of it so this was highly unpleasant, after having the window open for a while however the smell cleared. The room was large and clean and u could request clean linen when u wanted it. Rooms and beds were clean daily and the maids did a good job so we tipped them well. On the morning after our first nights sleep we found the toiled had been blocked. How this had happen I don't know. We told the front desk when we went out that morning and by the time we returned it was fixed. At the time we mentioned the toilet we also complained that the tv signal was rubbish and also that throughout the night the radiator was making really loud hissing so could they please fix that as it woke us up on many occasions throughout the night. Sadly these two issues weren't resolved during our stay. Another grumble is the water temperature of the shower and the hand basin. It was either red hot or cold u couldn't get a good mix on the temperature at all. On the plus side the staff were friendly and always available at the front desk. The included breakfast was good enough to start off the day with and there was always enough choice of bagels, bread, cereal fruit and doughnuts and there was always a seat spare to sit down. There was also free wi Fi which was strongest when in the lobby and they also had a Pc and printer which was free to use for 15 minutes per guest at a time. This was a great help when we wanted to check in on line for our returning flight and print off our boarding passes. All in all I would say that this hotel is in a great location with good staff. Personally we wouldn't stay here again though as we preferred the hotel Metro which is across the road and was in the same cost bracket ( we stayed there 2 years ago) If you would like any more info about our stay please PM me. Gem

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Comfort Inn Manhattan New York”
Reviews.Author: SWALK1955
Reviews.Content: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hW0qbJsCEws Stayed Comfort Inn Manhattan New York On 23rd-28th January 2010 12th Floor - Room 1203 Customer Service - Excellent A1 Value for money - also Excellent A1 Location - Awesome A1+ Complimentary tea and coffee in lobby Complimentary Yummy Continental Breakfast Complimentary WiFi HighSpeed Wireless Internet Access use of internet in lobby for free. Refrigerator - Microwave (In our room) All in all 100% Quality.. 28th Morning it was snowing - Awesome Just around the corner from Empire State Building, Macys largest department store in the world and lots more. If you travel with and arrange your package holiday via Virgin Holidays on your first visit with the Virgin representative you will be served with a complementary American breakfast not to be missed absolutely yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: cmp8254
Reviews.Content: For the cost, this is a decent find. A few short blocks and you are right in the heart of all NYC has to offer (ESB, Times Square, etc.). Stayed on the fifth floor, rooms were tiny, but got the job done. The free breakfast was strictly continental, but again got the job done with coffee, juices, donuts, bagels, cereal.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: shaunyweston
Reviews.Content: For a 2-star hotel, this is a real find. It's located very near Herald Street subway station (on 34th street) and is handy for shopping at Macy's, walking to Times Square or strolling into Tribeca. Our room was spacious and tidy, and had a great view of the Empire State Building. It was also rather hot, though the maintenance man kindly turned off our radiator, which made sleeping much more comfortable. There's free wifi in the room, though we often found it difficult to get a good connection (using iPad and iPhones), but we had no such problem in the lobby. Our shower was tricky to use, as the mixer taps couldn't get 'warm', so we were either freezing or very hot! The toilet was also very close to the bath, so not so comfortable. However, the bathroom was roomy and there were toiletries if we wanted them. Towels were abundant! A 'not so obvious' charge for the room safe is a dollar a day. The bed, though soft and comfortable, was a little too soft and comfortable! Was it a water bed? It seemed to 'ripple'! Breakfast at the adjoining restaurant is good, with bagels, doughnuts, waffles, toast, coffee, two cereals and a basket of fruit available. Virgin Holidaymakers can also sample the 'menu breakfast', which would normally cost between $10-20, for free. However, Manhattan is great for unique breakfast experiences, so get up early and start searching! The staff at reception are more appropriate for a 2-star, as they seem to argue with one another, and sometimes watch TV (one guy got rather excited about the Extreme Fighting that was on, which we didn't think was suitable). They're also polite when they choose to be, and they were quick to sort our radiator problem. On a budget, this isn't a bad hotel at all, but because we booked through Virgin Holidays, we're not sure exactly what the room rates are.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: astarblond
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 28th Jan after booking with Virgin Holidays. We had room 1205 which was on the top floor with a really good view of the Empire state, Room was lovely very spacious and nicely done out and the comfiest Bed I have stayed in! The selling point for this hotel really is the Location just off of 5th Avenue and around the corner from Macy's. Would definetly return to this hotel and recommend to Friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: amyztx
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Manhatten for 5 days in January and we had a really good time! The hotel itself was perhaps a little dated, but it was really clean and the staff were always very friendly, the complimentary breakfast was adequate and consisted of toast, muffins, bagels etc as well as tea and coffee, you could have as much as you wanted and it was fine for our needs. We ate in the ajoining resturant on our first night and the chicken ceaser salad was LOVELY! The only complaint I could make was that it was very hot on our room and you couldnt ajust the heat because it was built into a cabinate, however it was the middle of winter so being hot was definately better than being cold! Also we were on the second floor, it was slightly noisy at night at times, we could hear the people in the room next to us but they were only there for a night or so, the pipes for heating were also a bit noisy at times, but nothing major. The location is what makes this hotel, it was absolutely perfect, at the end of the road was Macy's round the corner was the empire state, and about a 5 block walk to Times Square - I could not have asked for a better location and we really enjoyed our stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value ...”
Reviews.Author: vanillamax40
Reviews.Content: Booked the whole trip through Virgin. Think this hotel is rated as 3 ticks according to Virgin which I gathered to be a bit better than a 3 star. The hotel in my opinion is a 2 star,It is very tired in parts and would benefit from a refurb. Must say however that the room was clean with plenty of fresh towels. Anyway, the bed was to our liking and very comfy, fridge & microwave in room was useful, there are no tea making facilities in room but there is complimentary tea & coffee in reception. Because of the hotels location is was a bit noisy on a night and early morning, earplugs remedied this! Breakfast was ok, toast, cereal, cakes ,donuts, waffles & juices. We decided to eat breakfast out as the quality of the food was much better. Can recommend the Tick tock diner, under the New Yorker hotel. Location was great, metro stop at the end of the street. Macy's and Empire State practically next door. There was a really well stocked general store around the corner, Herald Square market, can pick up all kinds of hot prepared food, freshly made wraps/sandwiches, soup as well as beer & water general supplies etc. Have read other comments made about unfriendly staff but we didn't experience anything other than helpfulness. I would recommend this hotel to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Riley-magoo
Reviews.Content: On my 5th visit to this city and the the second time I have stayed in this hotel, I feel I can give a justified review. I think it is important to remiind people that this is a 2/3 star hotel, so in effect, you get what you pay for. However, this hotel provides a higher class of stay than you'd expect of a 2/3 star place. The biggest positive of this hotel is the location. Perfectly situated in mid town. 10 mins walk to Flat Iron building, Times Square. 15 mins to Rockerfeller centre. Subway stop at the end of this street. It has to be said that some of the reception staff have typical NY attitudes, but I wouldn't say they are rude, they're just NY hotel staff and that means they don't have much time for anybody!!! Don't be offended and move on. Rooms are fine. Clean and considering it's a small hotel, quite big. I would recommend getting a double double room even if you are a couple. You get seperate beds but the rooms are much bigger. Now lets talk breakfast! For me this is a HUGE plus. OK, it's not all caviar and gold plates but it does the job. Fruit juice, cereal, eggs, bagels, DOUGHNUTS (only in America!) , tea coffee, fruit, toast. This is what to expect and given that breakfast at Lindy's or any other chain of restaurant will set you back $20 a visit it saves you the cash to spend on something better (like Knicks tickets!). The hotel also has a wonderful restaurant. We ate here twice during a 5 night stay and it was fantastic. You'll forget you're eating in you hotel. The food is very very good, especially the steak. The only downside to this hotel is the noise you might experience from the street if you have a room near ground level. Yes this is irritating, but you have to remember you are in the heart of New York's is town district.....it's never quiet. If you have an active holiday (and you should have given you are in NY), you'll only notice it on night one...after that you'll be so tired you could sleep through anything! I think it's important to set your expectations about this hotel. If you want a bloke at the front door opening it for you every time you walk in whilst greeting you with a smile and a good morning, then you'll be dissapointed. If you want a place that is accessible to the the subway and within 15 mins walking distance of NYC's top 10 attractions then this is for you. PLEASE don't be put off by the negative reviews written by people who expect a 2/3 star hotel to rival the Plaza. These people are fools who love to be negative at any given oppportunity. They want the experience of a 4 start hotel but are not willing to part with the cash! Take from someone who has experienced 4 different NY hotels on 5 different occaisons, this hotel offers convieince at an affordable price. If like me you couldn't afford to stay at a 5 str hotel in NY, then you can rest assured that you can stay here and still have a 5 star holiday. A little tip for anyone going to NY. Eat at JUNIORS! It's located at the Grand Central Terminal food court. The sandwhices are huge and the CHEESCAKE is unbelievably amazing!! I wil cetrainly be staying her again for visit number six!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, nice room but some really appalling reception staff”
Reviews.Author: CornwallDancer11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay - it was in an excellent position, and some of the staff were lovely. We gave good tips to some of them - however, some (and I emphasise SOME) of the reception staff were appalling - really rude, hated being parted from phone calls to answer a query and make rude remarks about "typical tourists" due to not getting or getting a tiny tip - maybe there was a reason for that guys!! We tipped those who were helpful and pleasant.... Overall it was comfortable, fairly clean (a bit scruffy in places but not terrible) and the continental breakfast was excellent - would recommend it with the above reservations!!! Pity

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lovers
Reviews.Content: Just got back today and found the hotel very comfortable with lovely comfy bed. Breakfast was basic but nice to start the day. The reception staff were not that friendly which spoilt it a bit. The best thing by far was the location, Superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - could have been made great very easily”
Reviews.Author: Family0nt0ur
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our hotel to find out that we had two rooms on a smoking floor. We had requested not to have these. One of the rooms would have been sleeping a 14 year old, and the room STUNK of cigarettes. So we went back down and asked the desk nicely if we could be moved, we were promptly told that we had not requested non smoking originally, (and?) and that this would mean someone else's booking being moved (and?). There are signs everywhere saying 'any problems, see the desk', 'non smoking rooms available upon request'. I don't enjoy being made to feel like it was a problem requesting this. In the end on of party got moved but it did mean we were 4 floors apart. Location was great, right by Macey's and the empire state building a subway station. Our room was big enough and very clean - the maid was absolutely lovely and charming. The free high speed internet was easy to connect to and fast. The sleep quality was very poor - it was to the point when I first entered the room I asked my partner if he'd left a window open. Due to being right in the heart of they city there were sirens going ALL NIGHT LONG. Please note there will probably be a review coming up now saying how quiet the hotel is and a made up story about having to change a room and the staff did it without delay -there is quite a noticeable pattern here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: marshy05
Reviews.Content: this hotel although only 2 star is in a great location turn left out of hotel and at end of block turn left and macys dept store is there out of hotel turn right end of block right again is empire state building, 10 mins walk to time square. The room was very comfortable we were on floor 3 overlooking the front of the hotel it could get a bit noisy when the dust carts came but this was only 1 morning so not so bad you have to expect a bit of noise in a city. The room had two double beds with very comfy mattresses and ensuite of adequate size. Another bonus was the free tea and coffee machine in the lobby 24hrs a day great for when you came in late. The free breakfast in the morning had cereals, toast, bagels,donuts, pastries tea coffee as much as you wanted a great start to the day. I would definitely stay here again if going to New York for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all our hopes and wishes.”
Reviews.Author: Aqua52
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we'd hoped for and so much more! We love this place, and when we return to New York City, we will definitely stay here again. The location was so convenient--half a block from the subway, a block and a half from the bus, and two blocks from the Empire State Building. We were two women traveling alone and felt very safe at night. We loved our room! We were on the 9th floor without a view, but it didn't matter. The room was very quiet, and we slept exceptionally well each night. The beds were very comfortable. The room had high ceilings, crown molding, a bay window, a large closet with a safe, and a nice bathroom with all new fixtures. There wasn't a scratch or a bit of rust or mold to be found anywhere. I can't think of anything I would do to change our room. It was absolutely perfect. The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and fun to visit with. We were afraid they might be stuffy and aloof, but that was certainly not the case. We felt like we became friends during our five nights there. We had so much fun visiting with them, and they were also extremely helpful when we needed it. The included free breakfast provided more than enough food to fill us up. Don't wait until the last 30 minutes to eat, though, because they do run out of food. The maid service was impeccable. Our room was cleaned very well each day. All amenities were kept fully stocked, the towels were replaced daily, and even our shower curtain was changed during our stay. Every evening when we returned to our room, it looked like we'd just walked into it the first time. I've never had a hotel room so thoroughly cleaned each day we were there. For our trip to NYC, we wanted an older hotel with some character, and that's exactly what we got at this Comfort Inn. The lobby was beautiful, the elevators were small and quaint, and the walk to our room included fun turns and twists along the way. We simply couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Also, there wasn't a bed bug in sight!

Reviews.Title: “What a great first NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: tparoxtar
Reviews.Content: I've always been told that hotel rooms in the city are very small, so I e-mailed ahead to the GM who set us up in a corner room that had a bay window facing 34th Street and the empire state building. All the staff was very courteous and the pricing was reasonable. You can't beat the location. There is a complimentary breakfast in the morning that contains 2 kinds of cereal, Eggo style waffles and other bakery goods. It's was a little less than I expected being that it's served in the bistro next door, but we never left hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: threerivers315
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend to experience the NYC Christmas atmosphere. Great location (walking distance) to all the main staples of the city. We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building! Great large windows to view this from. The room where they had the complimentary breakfast, which is just enough to start up your morning, was in a lovely restaurant. My only complaint was the mold on the ceiling just above the tub. Other than that, great location! Easy walk to Times Square, Macy's, Ave. Of Americas etc.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST !!!”
Reviews.Author: AliBOLTON
Reviews.Content: Just returned after our visit to new york, and our stay in the comfort inn we've stayed here 3 times, and would definatley recommend it, its clean, beds are so comfortable !! breakfast great, staff well must mention matthew who will go out of his way to help you, and milady on reception was really nice, very hospitable and helpful, ive stayed in quite a few hotels in the city, i would always return here without a doubt, the location is great, no other hotel i've stayed in have such friendly staff and the price is excellent, try it, it wont disappoint!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round”
Reviews.Author: Lesley71warren
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must to anyone visiting New York. I have been coming to this hotel now for 4 years, and its my friends 8th year. The service is FANTASTIC you couldnt wish for any better. The reception staff are just great, they treat you as if your one of the family. They are all very friendly and helpful, and always have a big smile on their faces. Nothing is ever any trouble big or little. We always go back to the same hotel as it is home from home. You can even wear your P.J's down to reception to have a cuppa, and no one would even say anything. The night staff enjoy your company in reception. Our rooms have always been immaculate clean, and every bed is just out of this world, they are so big and comfortable. The chambermaids clean the rooms every day, so when you return there is never any mess, and your beds are ready to jump into after a great day out. I also stay at this hotel as it is so close to Macy's, Time Square, Broadway, Diamond District, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building & Rockefeller Center. You can also have a walk to Central Park & visit many shops on the way, or get a cab down to Battery Park to see the Statue of Liberty. The best part of my stay at this hotel is breakfast. (FANTASTIC) It is something i look forward to every year. There is a wide range to choose from. Toast, Cereal, Bagals, Eggs, Cooked breakfast, waffals, Tea, Coffee, Juices and Doughnuts. Yes doughnuts. Help yourself to as much as you like!!!!!!! :) I havent got anything bad to say about this hotel as it is just A* all round. Price, food, bedrooms, reception, warm, Cleanliness,welcoming, friendly and much more. Lesley (UK)

Reviews.Title: “OK if you absolutely have to....otherwise don't bother...........”
Reviews.Author: scott_cop
Reviews.Content: This was the second stay at this hotel, the first being in May 2010. In May 2010 I had no choice as it was the only hotel available and I was booking the day before.......this time I was going in the first week of December and I was told that it was the busiest week of the year (my birthday week, typical!!)......so didn't have much choice either.....the only other available hotels were VERY pricey!!! First the positives, the location. This place is ideally situated slap bang central. You can walk to Penn station in 10 minutes....excellent if you are flying in to Newark (which I highly reccommend as it's much better than JFK - anyone who has been to both i'm sure will agree with me!!). You can walk to Macy's from the hotel in 4 mins, yes I did time it. Also, you can walk from the hotel the Times Square in less that 15 mins.....excellent!! ( just in case you were interested the train fare from Newark airport to Penn station is $12.50!) There is no room service here and no bell boys, or girls.....the lifts broke down once and we were on the 10th floor, wasnt fun!!. The room wasnt cleaned for any of the 3 nights I stayed there and there was mold in the bathroom on the caulking around the bath and on the walls..I do have photos which I will be uploading as soon as I can. I had to go to reception each day for clean towels 'cos they refused to bring them to the room, despite them not cleaning the room. Even when I mentioned about the rooms not being cleaned I received no apology, but the worst thing was you would at least expect them to get it cleaned the next day! C'est la vie!! I wont bang on about having to make my own bed whilst on holiday! A good thing is that there is free internet access in reception 24hrs, or if you have a laptop or wap phone then you can access it free in your room, this wasnt the case in May. I paid Â£750 for 3 nights here, purely out of having no choice due to everywhere being either fully booked or being stupidly priced........I WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN. There are so many other hotels in NY and i've been there twice now and stayed here both times not out of choice, so I feel that my review is fair, honest and balanced. Of you have any q's then please ask away. Another positive is that there is a free breakfast between 7-10 daily. It's only bagels, cereal and toast, oh and huge dirty doughnuts.....but its free and most places dont offer free breakfast. (tea, coffee and OJ as well).
