Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great price, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: BMG44
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very nice three night stay at the Comfort Inn. The staff was friendly and accommodating, we were able to check-in early. Our rom was clean, breakfast was included every morning, and the price was unbeatable. Location was perfect for our needs; 1/2 block from subway, Macy's, and 5th Ave. Very short walk to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and the heart of Times Square. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “No flaws at all”
Reviews.Author: Nina20102010
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical at first as the hotel seemed too reasonably priced for New York. But I could find no flaws with it. Rooms were clean and bigger than other hotel rooms in New York. Service was good, reception friendly, towels can be changed as often as you liked, no bed bugs, fairly quiet and above all a FANTASTIC location. Bearing in mind that few city travellers spend a lot of time in their hotel room I wouldn't know why anyone else would want to stay in a more expensive place. Breakfast was good too, it is rare to have breakfast at all in hotels i the US and the bagels, muffins, waffles, oatmeal, juices certainly helped kickstart our day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: dawalker05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on October 21st. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. They made some great recommendations for dinner and breakfast. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Ramjam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 2009 and I have no complaints at all. The location is great (right next to Herald Square) , the staff were very helpful and welcoming, the complimentary Breakfast buffet was hearty, our room was large, clean and cosy. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and price”
Reviews.Author: Bouviers
Reviews.Content: We were leaving from Penn Station the next morning for Niagara Falls (very scenic and inexpensive train journey if you have the time) and this Comfort Inn was close and less than $200 a night (which is great for NYC). Surprisingly the room was huge and the building was an historic one with curved marble staircases. The staff were helpful and restaurants are nearby (also Macy's Herald Square and the Empire State Building). We were even able to hail a cab in the rain during rush hour in the morning so we didn't have to drag our bags to the train station!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and apathetic”
Reviews.Author: SawtoothinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel due to not being able to get a room at the other NYC hotels I usually use. That turned out to really be too bad. I paid $270 plus all taxes. The lobby is small and dirty, ditto the elevators and my room was dusty, smelled of old smoke (opening the windows never got rid of the smell) and had a small couch in it that looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in weeks. There is no gym or arrangement with a nearby gym. The staff is particularly apathetic and did not pay attention to my payment by way of my office when I checked in, which caused me a lot of inconvenience. Did anyone care? Not really. I felt sorry for the British tourists staying there, but maybe they got a better rate. I will avoid Comfort Inns in NYC at all costs from now on. The only good point is that this one is very near Penn Station. If they redid the rooms, some of them are corner rooms and COULD be quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mugby
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel after reading the reviews but must say we were dissapointed in the room. It was very dark with no windows and the air con was very noisy. The bathroom floor was not very clean and the shower did not work, but after seeing the front desk it was fixed straight away. We were only here for three days so could put up with it. It is ideally situated for all the shopping and sights and the virgin rep was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kms61
Reviews.Content: We stay 2 nights in New York at the Comfort Inn Manhattan - 42W 35ST, New York. What a great place to stay. We were 4 mins walk to the Empire State Building and 2 mins walk to Macy's. We took a walk to Time Square and could not believe how close it was. Less than 10 mins and we had to boys 11 & 8 with us. The room was fantastic, very clean and also quite roomy for New York. We had a queen bed and a sofa couch/bed for the children. We had lots of room with the sofa not set up and still plenty of room once it was converted to a bed. Beds were very comfortable also. Lots of storage space for your clothes. We had a small walk in cupboard where we could hang up clothes and also store our bags, plus lots of draws to put things in. Had an ok view out our window. The pizza shop across the street had great New York Pizzas. Price included a buffet contint

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect In Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: jackieh72
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 11 nights for my husbands 40th. i had stayed here 12 years ago and due to location and value we decided to go back again. the hotels location is fantastic - right in the heart of the city. the hotel staff are amazing, so friendly and helpful. the rooms are spacious and clean and have room service daily. the complementary breakfast is wonderful, there are hardly any hotels in nyc that offer free breakfast, ok so its cereal, donuts, bagels, muffins, eggs but to be honest it suited us perfectly and set us up for the day without having to waste time looking for somewhere to eat. if we are lucky enough to return to the big apple for a 3rd time i would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MissMoo92
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself went to New York in June 2010, we were originally due to go in April but due to the ash cloud that smothered us, we had to move the trip to a different ASAP date. So we decided to go in June and thank god we did! it was phenomenal weather and the trip ended up being Â£200 cheaper! We booked a car beforehand (def recommend due to yellow cabs rip off tourists) and it dropped us right on our door step. The doorman at the hotel were delightful and took our suitcases out the car and into the hotel, the reception was very welcoming and very polite staff. As we arrived at lunchtime they informed us of the Brendan's bar and grill which is in the hotel building which was helpful as we were too jet lag to go running around for food. The elevator was a little slow but was very classic, all architecture was lovely. We were on the 10th floor and our room was so lovely. Everything was clean, the bed was gorgeous and we had view of the empire state! breath taking or what!? It was everything I hoped my first NY trip would be like. The rooms are good sizes and have plenty of closet space. The bathroom was great and spotless! Breakfast was included and it was great to start the day off before we went on our bus tours. Nothing too heavy but theirs waffles and dohnuts. Fresh fruit and bagels. Very delightful. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “There are probably better value budget hotels in the city”
Reviews.Author: mackyUK
Reviews.Content: I was under no false illusions about this 2 star hotel and I would have rated it 3 stars but for some major issues which I consider essential when paying a four figure sum (in Stirling) for a 6 night stay. The good things about the hotel... > Friendly reception staff > Free continental breakfast (not European though â€“ food is from the American continent such was waffles and bagels) > Good location The not so good... > Very small double beds which are quite uncomfortable for two adults > No view whatsoever â€“ in fact â€“ I think the window had never been cleaned > Extremely noisy air con which meant a very noisy night or a very warm night The primary reason for my negative review is that when checking out of the hotel the Bell Boy/Doorman asked me if my family required a car for the airport and all that I needed to pay was a $10 deposit. I accepted the offer and was given back a receipt with a bill for $65 but the standard price for a NYC cab to JFK is only $45, furthermore, I could not cancel the car without losing the $10 deposit that I have just paid. It gets worse... on route to JFK the driver informed me that there was still TAX, tip and toll to pay which resulted in the final bill being nearly twice the amount of a standard cab fare. The hotel and/or the Bell Boy/Doorman has some sort of deal in place with a private car company so book your own cab and if you do decide to stay in this small hot hotel.

Reviews.Title: “basic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WestCountryPoppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a large room on the 12th floor with 2 double beds(3 of us).Room was clean but very dark with a view of a wall and a bit of the Empire State building.The lift was slow and there were only 2.The hotel is next to a bar where breakfast is served.Breakfast was dire with poor quality juice,old fruit,waffles,bagels very hard butter(almost frozen)and bread.It was 'complimentary' so I suppose we got what we paid for.Staff were informative but sometimes were abrupt.Free 15 min internet access in the lobby .It was very hot (in the upper 80s)when we stayed-unusually warm for this time of year but the air con in the room worked perfectly.Location is pretty good with Macy's a 2 minute walk away and a subway 1 minute away.We paid $230 per night but this didn't include tax at about 14.5% and charges which were $12 per night.Would I recommend this hotel to a friend?? Not if they were at all fussy or could afford more and if they were to stay here I would recommend they went to the local deli/cafe for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jackiexbx
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying here, was close to everything - empire state, madison square, times square. Room was excellent and staff were really friendly and helpful. Will be staying here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Dated. Average. Noisy but excellent central location.”
Reviews.Author: SamandPaul1
Reviews.Content: Very average older hotel. We and others had problems with the plumbing system. Many of staff do not speak good English. Didnt come across as friendly and helpful. Good breakfast included. Very noisy area (probably all of central New York is!) Handy for attractions. Walking Distance to Times Square, Macys and Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TheBavers
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner for one night on 6th August 2010. We were flight to Miami for London heathrow and had a connection in JFK over night. We payed $199 (Â£130) for one night and we thought this was a little expensive but well it is New York. The room was clean and comfortable and we had an excellent view of the empire state building that is only a 2 minute walk away from the hotel. The breakfast in the hotel was excellent with a good verity for breakfast (included) from bagles to fruit. The staff were friendly and the added bonus was they had a facility to store our suit cases as our flight was at 7pm and we had to check out by 11am. Overall very good and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to taking a cruise from NY. Excellent service from the front desk, booked us a cab for the following day Room clean and tidy. Ate in the adjacent hotel restaurant (Lannigans Brassierie) as you gain 15% discount. Ideal location for Broadway, Empire State building and 5th Avenue. On check out they stored our bags so we could explore until 1pm. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Anitamariet
Reviews.Content: Close to attractions and transport. Clean and tidy. Good service, Good breakfasts. Nice friendly bar. Only snag was that we couldn't see out of the tiny window facing a wall so it was a little claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Good location clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: bluesfanEastSussex
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Rooms were quite dark. Good storage space for suitcases. 10 to 20 minutes walk to Times Sq depending on how fast you walked.!! There was a good selection of local restaurants. A friend had previously stayed and recommended thehotel to us. Good for a three night stay (first part of our East Coast road trip). As regards to the Empire State Building which is 5 minutes walk away. We arrived at 8 am on Saturday morning no long lines we purchased our tickets and went straight up. Fab views.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: markgparker
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, could see the Empire State Building from our window. Clean and staff helpful. Breakfast was very basic but set you up for the day. Free tea and Coffee at the entrance, just help yourself. Very busy at the lift's in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely situated”
Reviews.Author: LuxorSheffield
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated on 35th west and 5th Avenue close to Maceys and Empire state building. After arriving from massive hotel in Vegas the hotel appeared to be very small especcially the bathroom, but was very clean and tidy and the staff was very good especcially Mathew (bellhop). Our room was quite noisy with the traffic outside ( horns always blaring) but this is common throughout Manhattan. All in all I would recommend it,and we are in our late fifties.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Vintage, Okay”
Reviews.Author: DiamondDude
Reviews.Content: Last minute situation--I didn't have a reservation but the staff was very kind when checking me in. Rate was great for NYC. Room was small as you'd expect for a budget hotel in NYC. The bed took up most of the room and the bed wasn't large. You had to work to find a big enough space to unfold the ironing board. The hot water handle came off if you didn't finesse it just right. The TV was 1970's vintage. But it was a well located, clean place to rest my head and sometimes that's all you need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!! wish i found this hotel a long time ago-loved everything about this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bavavia
Reviews.Content: Read many good reviews of the Comfort Inn here on TAdvisor, so i decided to give it a try on Saturday, 7/24/10. Perfect stay! No super fancy lobby or pricey perks, but clean, comfortable and a super value! My room was ready when i arrived and i requested a room in corner and away from elevator and that is what they gave me. I was expecting a really basic room, tiny...etc... but when i entered my room, i was pleasantly suprised at the nicely sized room. I was on a corner, so had two windows and even a window in my bathroom! the walls are thick and windows are soundproof, i did not hear anything outside except a police siren in the morning once, thats it. No noise from above or next to me. Super quiet. Bed... super comfy! i slept very well..The bathroom was nice, a little small, but nothing unusually small. I liked how the bathrooms were updated, so even though there was not a ton of shelf space in the bathroom, the shelf there was made of granite, so they added nice touches in the design. The room rate includes a nice breakfast in the restaurant connected to the hotel. I did not eat breakfast though, but saw the choices looked good. Coffee,pastries, fruits, bagels, etc. Just a lovely hotel that is economically friendly, clean, quiet, great location. You cant go wrong by staying here!! There is not parking at hotel, but directly across street is where they tell you to park if you drive in.. its $ 25 for the night which isnt bad..! The hotel itself does not have a restaurant, but there is a restaurant connected to hotel ( but they are not affiliated, but they do provide the breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Matthew is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn059
Reviews.Content: If you want to walk to a lot of Manhattan's points of interests, this is the hotel for you. Matthew works the lobby and is VERY helpful and friendly. We loved our stay there, and Matthew made our stay even more terrific. I highly recommend this Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bj105094
Reviews.Content: I normally don't stay in this location but was leaving from Penn Station so I decided to give this hotel a try. The location was great but the hotel itself was quite basic. It was clean but an old hotel. I got a great internet rate so I guess I got what I paid for. The bathroom was extremely small and cramped. The toilet was virtually unuseable as the wall came out in a weird angle so there was noway a woman would be able to sit down. The shower pressure was no good and the water kept going from hot to cold. It was a good hotle for the price but I donÃ¸t think I would of stayed there for anymore then a couple nights.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute!!! Thanks Holiday Inn :)”
Reviews.Author: lillybetWiltshire
Reviews.Content: It was my first big adventure by myself and i was nervous about what i would find, but the Hotel was GREAT!!!!, the staff were welcoming and well knowledgable too, My room was clean and spacious, yes the toliet was a little small but i didn't come to New York to stay in the toilet so that didn't bother me. The breakfast was very good and Brendans Bar and Grill served great food. The hotels Location is Amazing, a five minute walk gets you to Times Square and the view from my bedroom window was the brilliant Empire State Building (room 709), You have to go up there at Night, it will take your breath away, I would defianately go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jackrichards
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Manhattan in January, the hotel is located really close to Macy's, Times Square and the Empire State Building, and there is s Subway station at the end of the road if you want to go a bit further afield. The room was enormous, with two double beds, a bathroom and a walk in closet. There was also a safe in the room. The room we had looked down onto 35th Street, no noise at all with the windows closed, if you opened them you could hear the real bustle of new york with car horns and taxis in the street below. Rooms very clean with maid service 7 days per week. Beds very comfortable and large. Breakfast is included, its basic but tides you over till lunch. Eating out can be to two extremes, restaurants in the back streets serve excellent food cheaply, although we tended to eat out in Times Square, a bit more expensive but excellent quality, I really recommend Ruby Tuesdays - the food is incredible! We also did the New York Liberty Helicopters Tour, again expensive, but worth it! I would definately return to this hotel if going back to new york.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Laura900
Reviews.Content: Great location 1 block from macys and empire state building, 15 min walk to times square. Hotel was clean rooms are a good size bathrooms a little small but very clean. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful complementary breakfast was great.Brendans next door was great, food was excellent. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: spudmassive
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the hotel for 4 nights for her 40th birthday. It was an extremely comfortable and welcoming hotel, lovely room. It is ideally placed in the middle of all the attractions of Manhattan New York. The Empire State Building was on the next street down and Macy's at the end of our street. Short walk to Times Square. Matthew the Concierge at Comfort Inn is really friendly and made us feel welcome. The breakfast is continental (what let us down is the plastic cutlery) but if you are staying there through Virgin Holidays then your first breakfast is a fully cooked one (proper cutlery!). Nice bar attached to the Hotel (Brendan's). Local Irish bar's if you fancy a pint or two and if you have the chance have a night out at the Coyote Ugly bar situated on 1st Avenue (not to be missed!). Broadway shows also a must.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: suz..888
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on trip advisor and speaking to a friend who stayed at this hotel, we decided to book a weekend here with Virgin as my first trip to the States. NY was amazing - the photos don't do it justice! The people were very helpful and we didn't feel intimidated at all. The prices for food and clothes etc. were pretty much on a par with London due to the poor exchange rate. The hotel itself is in an excellent location - 1 block from the ESB in one direction and 1 block from Macy's in the other. A subway stop on the same block can take you out and about if your feet start to hurt(!) and times square is literally a 10 minute walk away tops. The breakfast was fine - plenty of cereal, muffins, doughnuts, apples, waffles and bagels. Also, tea, coffee and fruit juice to choose from. On our 1st morning we had the Virgin rep meeting on the 1st floor of the restaurant where we had a free full breakfast - I chose the pancakes, very nice! The staff on the reception desk were very helpful and always said hello. They also kept our bags until our taxi came - no problems there. We did lock the cases and take all valuable out - as you would anywhere. Our room was spot on - great shower with ample hot water, a bath (shower over the bath), small table and 2 chairs and good size bed. The wardrobe was big enough for 2 and had a safe in it. The safe costs about $4 which you pay for when you leave, cheaper than what they charge in the Med on your summer hols. The room was very clean and we had a great view of the ESB - room 509. The restaurant food in the evening was ok - a bit over priced compared to others but convenient if you are too tired to go out and about. Note: The menu in your room is different to the one in the restaurant though so don't get choosing until you are actually in the restaurant or you may be disappointed! Virgin were great - our transfers were bang on time, the rep was helpful and friendly and all went to plan. We flew with Continental who were also great - kept us well fed and watered during the flight and had a good choice of films etc on your own personal screen. This was my first long-haul and went far better than expected. The only down side is that the hotel only has 2 slow lifts - a bit of a pain in busy times, but not really a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location”
Reviews.Author: Charles235
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York, we travelled there with Virgin holidays on a three centre holiday, Las Vegas, Cancun and then New York for 3 nights for our Pearl wedding anniversary and what a holiday. After chilling in Cancun we were recharged for the hussle and bussle of New York. The hotel was what we expected, lovely and clean, friendly staff and the location was excellent, the next street from the Empire State Building, we went up there the night we arrived about 11pm (it was open until 2am) and what a perfect time to go, no queues, and the view, absolutely fantastic. The continental breakfast was sufficient to set us up for the day and saved time and money to look for it elsewhere, and the first morning we had a free cooked breakfast courtesy of Virgin when we met with their rep, he was in the hotel every morning for advice, that was great. We bought a two day pass for the Citysites blue tour bus which was great as we saw everything there was to see and the guides are very informative, it also included a night tour of Brooklyn and a harbour Cruise past the statue of Lliberty. We also went up the Top of the Rock (Rockafella Centre) in the day and the views were just as breathtaking as from the Empire, if not better, all of Central Park and even down to the Statue of Liberty in the distance. The location of the hotel was also ideal to walk down Broadway to Time Square, 5th Avenue shopping not forgetting Macey's for designer bags, clothes etc, although we didn't find it that much cheaper than back home. Food and drink was about the same as home but alcohol more expensive not that we had much time for that, but had a meal last night and a pint of guinness was 7 dollars as much as a short but we were in the middle of a city so expected. All in all a truly memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for a second time”
Reviews.Author: UKVisitor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay at the Comfort Inn. We thought it was great first time and were not disappointed this time. Check in was quick, efficient and the lady gave us vouchers for various attractions and a discount card for 25 % of a Macys which is about 100 yards away. It is a great location with subways and busses in all directions, if you go for more than 3 days get the weeks Metro pass it pays for itself. Our room on the 11th floor was spacious with 2 double beds (each bed possible a bit small for 2 people) great for 2 ladies .The bathroom was quite adequate with lots of hot water and clean towels every day the only slight problem was lack of ventilation which made it a but hot after a shower. The beds were really comfortable and we both slept very well, there was some noise from the street but nothing to cause any great problem. The free breakfast was a bonus, orange juice, cereal, porridge, toast, begels, eggs, cream cheese. butter, jam, tea and coffee, Yes it was busy at some times but we always got a seat as you can use the bar area. Check out was a breeze Matthew stored our bags for us and took special care of my babies ( 3 posters I bought from the MoMa). On arrival at Newark EWR , long queues for immigration and we still had to fill in those forms despite doing the ESTA on line. We used SuperShuttle to get to and from EWR it was 18 USD one way and we bought a return ticket for 17USD at the airport. Leave plenty of time for getting back to the airport. Our flight was 7.40 pm and we left the hotel at 3 pm, it was a Sunday afternoon but the traffic was terrible it took an hour to get to the terminal. Checking in with Continental was a very long job they were very disorganised it took 1 hour 30 minutes to check in and get through security. TOP TIP - leave at least 4 hours from hotel to flight. Great hotel Great location We will definitely use it next time ( hopefully) we are in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: FB1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during April 2010 - it was a hotel we were moved to by our tour operators as a result of staying in NYC a week longer than planned due to the Icelandic volcano ash cloud. Having stayed in a 5 star hotel previously we can honestly say the staff and the atmosphere were much better at this hotel. The rooms were clean, well decoarated and served their purpose. The staff couldn't do enough to help us and the location was perfect for sight seeing and shopping. This hotel serves its purpose well - somewhere to lay your head and have breakfast. A big thank you to Matthew on the front desk for keeping us up to date on the news and doing his best to please lots of distressed Brits.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Robo34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay there very much. We had no complaints. I'm not sure if any place in Manhattan is quiet, but as far as the hotel goes, it was quiet enough. Check-in and front desk were friendly. The location was close to Times Square and and we had a perfect view of the Empire State Building one block away. We were a half block from the subway which will take you almost anywhere you want to go in New York. Breakfast was limited, but nice to have. There was free coffee and tea in lobby. There is also a computer in the lobby to check the internet in case you don't have a computer with you. If I go back to New York, I won't mess around trying to find another hotel. This hotel was perfect and we'll stay again. We even forgot something in our hotel room when we went home, but they were very helpful in working with us to send it back.

Reviews.Title: “Such good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Winchcombe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the second time and once again were not disappointed. The service was very good. Our room although small was comfortable and very clean. The complimentary breakfast( very unusual for New York hotels) was limited but very welcome and sets you up for the day. The hotel has a bar which is very lively early evening with homeward bound office workers. It also has a restaurant which we didn't use but if you are staying at the hotel you get 15% off the bill which you also get at the Irish bar opposite. The menu looked good but we preferred to go out and about in the evening. The location is spot on, if you turn left out of the hotel you are at Macys, if you turn right you are on 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building. It is a short walk to Times Square and a slightly longer but reachable walk to Central Park. The best things about this hotel were the location, the price and the friendliness of the staff. The worst things were the temperamental hot water system which sometimes took 5 minutes(yes really!) to reach our 12th floor room. However we think this hotel has much more going for it than against it and would not hesitate to stay there for the 3rd time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe4912
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 15 year old son at the Comfort Inn Manhattan. I was a little sceptical as I got out of my yellow cab from the airport, mainly because the hotel entrance was small, no doorman and different to the larger hotels that I have previously stayed in in New York. All that was to change. From checking in, the staff were really helpful. The lifts were a little slow but the hotel is older so I expected this and it didnt cause a problem at all. On getting to our room I couldnt believe how lovely it was. Really clean, comfy beds, large TV which my son couldnt wait to switch on, and plenty of room to put clothes, suitcases etc in a walk in closet. I liked the fact that the room had its own safe deposit box. The room was quite dark, it did have several lamps but admittedly the light wasnt great, but then I didnt come to New York just for a well lit room. On opening the curtains I was rewarded with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building - what more could you ask for. The hotel is central for everything, everything right on your doorstep, underground station more or less right outside the door. Brendans cafe is lovely, right next door. Macys literally over the road. Just a brilliant base to get around everywhere. Times Square is literally a 10 minute walk away and probably about a 20 minute walk to the stores on 5th Avenue - just brilliant. Breakfast consisted of waffles and donuts, toast and cereal and an abundance of coffee and juice. It was enough for first thing in the morning. Theres a great selection on the room service menu too. Will definitely book this hotel next year rather than the flashier bigger hotels who seem to spend more time doing up the lobby than refurbing the actual rooms. This was a comfy, small, friendly, hotel right in the heart of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and price!”
Reviews.Author: CAR09
Reviews.Content: The hotel perfectly fit our needs. The rooms were a good size (a little small, but still great), bathrooms were great and we even had a small walk-in closet. The staff was friendly and very helpful and the continental type breakfast was good. Easy access to everything especially when a subway station was at the end of the block! Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC. The elevators were a little small and slow, but the hotel is older which means it has tons of character (and I mean that in a good way). And if you have a street view, it can be a bit noisy sometimes. Those were the only negatives we could find.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor - very happy the 2nd time around!!!!”
Reviews.Author: drdre24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Manhattan for the 2nd time last week with a group of 21 high school aged foreign exchange students and we were once again very happy with our stay. You can not beat this location. A short walk to Times Sqaure but far enough away that you do not get the hustle and bustle of the crowd. Kudos once again to the staff, especially Tony, Brian and Matt. We look forward to seeing you again next year!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The fabulous big Apple”
Reviews.Author: pigletdoesNY
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to New York and the best location, the hotel was alittle dated but in all excellent value for money! our bathroom was rather small but the rest of the room was a good size & the bed was very comfortable (which was well needed after a long day of sight seeing and shopping) our room was on the 10th floor, which was good for noise reduction. Brendans bar was great for the evening meal and the 15% off of food for people staying made it great value! The free cooked breakfast on the first morning was fabulous! and the help yourself continental breakfast was a good to start to the day. I have stayed in better hotels before but personally I would go back to the comfort inn for the location and the friendly bar & hotel staff. Machines with cold drinks were on every other floor on the stairs along with ice machines.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: jpinning
Reviews.Content: What can I say, 3 mins walking to the biggest store in the World and 3 mins walk to the Empire State Building, this was our 4th trip to NYC and the best location we have ever stayed at. This hotel is basic but perfectly adequate. Rooms are clean and spaceous, breakfast is great and a bonus as it is complimentry. We had a great 7 night stay and would recommend this hotel and NYC to anyone. Also check out "The Playwrights" bar opposite, they have great happy hours and the food is excellent, in fact we ate there 4 nights out of 7.

Reviews.Title: “needs a refurb”
Reviews.Author: greenoak91
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a fantastic location,close to just about everywhere you want to see,but it is badly in need of a re-furb,its showing signs of its age,the rooms especially are dark and dingy. on the upside though the staff are friendly and very helpful.the free breakfast is very good,and that area of the hotel is the most welcoming,being part of brendans bar and grill,they need walk ins to make it pay which probably explains why it looks so much better than the rest of the building. i intend to go back to N.Y. again next year,but i will try a different hotel next time

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: paradise-seeker-fin
Reviews.Content: The ideal location of the hotel made our 6-night-stay perfect.. The Empire State Building is just around the corner, so is MacyÂ´s and the Manhattan Mall,, and itÂ´s only a short walk to Times Square and Madison Square Garden. The first room that we got (the cheapiest, standard room) was on the sixth floor. We could the ESB from our window. No noise from the streets or other rooms could be heard. However, the bed was very small for 2 people, the toilet was impossible to sit on and the heating did not work. It was freezing cold there. They tried to fix the radiotor but did not succeed in getting it fixed. Therefore we were moved to the fifth floor and got a much bigger room with two beds and lots of space. You could hear more traffic noise in this room since it faced the street but the space we had was more important. The bes were very comfortable and the heating worked, a bit too well I think :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel & fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: fladavid
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the "Big Apple" & by god it blew us all away! The hotel couldn`t possibly be any more central with The Empire State Building situated one block behind & Macy`s literally across the road. We were worried as some people had said it was in need of an update & was dirty,well i didn`t think so. Our rooms looked like they had been refurbished & everything was clean,except for the windows which admitedly were filthy,such a shame as you want to look out of the window a lot! The only areas i would agree that need an update are the stairwells & lift areas they still have woodchip paper & strange coloured paint. The staff were very helpfull,managing to get two rooms next to each other for us as i had forgot to ask when booking. Also the breakfast is great seeing as it is complimentary,it gets you started for the LONG day ahead lol!! If you are staying here try to get a high level room as we were on the 6th floor & were still woken up in the early hours by the "city that never sleeps"! So to sum up this is a decent enough hotel for the money you are paying,you want the Waldorf then pay Waldorf prices. Believe me you won`t be in the room long enough to worry about it as there is so much to see & do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: KareBear614
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and really enjoyed our stay there. We arrived shortly after 1pm and were able to check into our room already. The hotel staff was very friendly and upon check-out the first thing they asked us if we would like to store our bags which I thought was very courteous. The room was larger in size than I expected for a NYC hotel. The room we stayed in looked to be recently rennovated. The wall papering, painting, furniture, comforters, and even the tile in the shower and the sink looked on the newer side. There was a very nice flat screen TV on the wall. The beds were comfortable and the room was very quiet at night. The window had no view except of another building. The breakfast was decent for a continental breakfast. If you are someone who wants donuts and pastries you need to get there before 9am though or they run out. It was always busy at breakfast and seating could be difficult to find. My only complaints would be about the narrow hallways and the elevators. The hallways are very narrow and when the maid cart is out it is very difficult to squeeze by the cart to get through to your room. The elevators are very tight so during busy times there is a long wait for an elevator. I would recommend requesting a room on a lower level. We were on level 3 so usually chose the stairs over the elevator. The stairs are very narrow and winding though. A close walk to the garden and Macys. The hotel was great is is going to be the only hotel we stay at in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: hoopoe01
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at this hotel once before and chose it again for three reasons: it's close to Penn Station and Amtrak, they have great bagels at the free breakfast, and it's one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed at. I got a last minute reservation for $139 which is great for Manhattan. But, be forewarned, this is a renovated apartment building and some of the rooms are very oddly shaped and some look onto an air shaft. I got the air shaft this time; however, the bathroom looked it had been redone just the week before. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark360
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right beside Macys, American Eagle, Gap etc, and one street from the Empire State Building and within 10minutes walk to Times Square. The hotel itself is great for the price we paid. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful with any queries you might have. The breakfast is very handy and tasty, good start to the day. And also a 15% discount in this restaurant for lunch/dinner etc once you show your room card. I will say however to avoid the Transport man on your departure day, as he is extremely rude,obnoxious, and quite unhelpful and mixes up the bags. Just stick with the yellow cabs getting to and from the airport and you will have no problems. This did not ruin our stay at the hotel as all other staff were fantastic towards us.

Reviews.Title: “New York”
Reviews.Author: juanillo33
Reviews.Content: Cheap Price and only several blocks from times square and one block away from Macy's

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Janine022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn from 20th - 25th January 2010 - overall we were quite impressed with the hotel, particularly the location - the location was awesome - two minutes walk from Macy's and five minutes to the Empire State Building, one minute to the subway. Also, close to Times Square and walkable distance to Central Park (except for the whining children!). Our room was fine - small but clean. The view was one of the wall of a building next door, however, if we adopted a contortionist type stance, we could see the base of the Empire State Building!! We are a family of four and it was a little 'testing' having the four of us in the one room and sharing double beds, however as a previous review indicated, we were there to see New York, not to hang out in our hotel room. I would certainly recommend the hotel for couples as the room would not be quite so 'cozy' as it was for us. The breakfast was great and the staff were helpful and provided good advice re getting around around etc. So, no complaints from this family..............

Reviews.Title: “best location with macy's only a minute away”
Reviews.Author: lotado
Reviews.Content: arrived on 19th & although the room was very basic we were here to see new york not the hotel, if you want tea or coffee grab it on your way into the lobby as there is nothing in the rooms to make you own, the room did seem a little dull but was clean & warm, we were on the 7th floor at the front a little noisey but it is a city that never sleeps, staff were ok, breakfast not massive but gets you started for the day, great location macy's a minute away, empire state building less than 5 mins away times sqaure & central park are an easy walk and plenty to see & do on the way. to sum it up fantastic location, hotel as decribed basic but ok, overall trip was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and what a view!”
Reviews.Author: Lozzy673
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a group of four from 16th December to the 20th. We had two rooms one for myself and my partner in our 20's and another for my parents who are in their 50's. Transfer from JFK took around 45 minutes and cost around 60 dollars including tips and tolls in a yellow cab from outside the airport. The enterance to the hotel is bright and welcoming with a place to get free hot drinks from in the foyer. The staff on reception informed us we had two smoking rooms. We all all non-smokers but unfortunatly they could only change one of the rooms so my partner and I stuck with the smoking room. On entering the room I was very pleased we didn't swap as we had a fantastic view of the empire state building! Our room was room 708. My parents room had a slightly less interesting view from room 610 of a wall and drain pipe! We found the rooms to be more than adequate for what we wanted, a base for a full on site seeing holiday. The only drawback I found of our room was the bathroom. The toilet was really close to the bath so made it hard to sit on! The bed was comfy and the flat screen tv was good in the room. The room did smell of smoke at first but I guess this is what you expect from a smoking room. It is an old building and I did not like the stairs, they were quite tight and small, the elevators are a much better option but at peak times such as breakfast you had to wait quite a while for one. The rooms were very warm which was a good thing as it was minus 5 outside and snowing! Also we had no problem with hot water for baths and showers. We didnt notice much noise from outside at all. Nowhere near what we expected. Maybe this was becasue we were high up? Also other guests were quiet and we heard very little noise at all from our room. Breakfast was an added bonus for us as we did'nt even realise it was included at the time of booking. It was fine, there was toast, eggs, doughnuts, bagels and cereal to choose from. Also hot drinks and orange and apple juice. We also likes the free wifi and the computer in the enterance that you could use for free and print out your bording passes to check in online which was great and meant we could choose our seats for the way back. For dinner for three of our nights we went to 'O' Reileys' irish bar over the road. You got a 10 percent discount from being from the hotel if you told them. The bar downstairs was always very busy but we went upstairs to the restaurant and thought it was great with a nice atmosphere and good attentive staff. We didnt try the hotels restaurant 'Brendans' but it looked nice. Check out was at 12 and our flight was not until 9pm so we left the five bags with the reception. We tipped the man 5 dollars although he didnt seem to be expecting this at all and was grateful. Incedently this was the only time we tipped inside the hotel. The reception booked our taxi and then helped us to put the bags in when it arrived. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel and would definatley stay there again. It was a great base for our holiday. If you want a posh modern hotel then this isnt for you but as a good standard, clean hotel in an excellent location for a good price then give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “our room stank of cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: suzym73Ireland
Reviews.Content: The room was typical new york small but ok, however the overhwelming smell of cigarette smoke spoilt it terribly for us. no view from our room the windows and curtains were so dirty. i bought an airfreshner and sprayed it liberally throughout our stay. the location is excellent but the staff were mediocre, they didnt pass on a message left for us at reception, werent interested in our stay. the bathroom was damp and not that clean. sheets and bed were clean and comfortable, if you can afford any thing else dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “..Excellent Hotel..FAB Location..Great Stay..”
Reviews.Author: jem_and_matt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 23/11/200 for 5 nights. The hotel room we were allocated was great. Two double beds in the room, good size room, with ensuite, television and built in wardrobe. The hotel was perfectly located for a New York Trip. It was 2mins from Macys, a short walk to times Square and just around the corner from 5th Avenue. The breakfast which was included and was great, coffee, tea, juice and a selection of fruit, cereals, waffles, doughnuts etc. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful (especially when we wanted advise on using the subway). I would definately recommend this hotel for a stay in New York if you want to be in the heart of everything!! A thoroughly enjoyable stay at the Comfort Inn...

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel if it's more than $100”
Reviews.Author: buradley
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this property last night - It was one of those times when most other hotels were so booked up the prices to stay were prohibitive - so i tried this property, even though I still had to pay $244. The place is tired - My room was very small, and had an industrial odor - There are two small elevators - which are shared by the hotel staff and guests, so although I was staying on the sixth floor - i ended up using the stairs 4 times as the elevators were just not available. The breakfast is extremely uninviting - like they just put something out to say they have it. The worst nit picky thing though is the bill includes a $1.04 charge for in room safe warranty - doesn't matter if you use it or not, you have to pay it. It is an odd fee - and a bit insulting I would not return

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday”
Reviews.Author: CarrieBlack
Reviews.Content: Great location!! Quite a dated hotel but has what you need as a base. No tea/coffee facilities in room, only in hotel lobby.. But it does have a Mountain Dew vending machine!!! And free internet access if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saintsfanengland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Comfort Inn Manhatten for 6 nights from the 10th September, we were on the 12th floor, and the Empire State Building was our view - WOW!!!! Totally amazing. Check in desk & reception staff efficient and friendly, rooms were nice, bed was comfy, the stair wells were in a little need of re-decorating but didn't really care, we were well happy. Breakfast is included in your stay, bagels/pastries/cakes/pancakes/eggs/cereal/waffles etc. Location was perfect 5/10 min walk to Times Square, Empire State literally behind the hotel, Macy's at the end of the road, Subway's close by. Nice little Irish Bar O'Reilley's across the road was brill, went there most evenings. Will definately come back to this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location no complaints”
Reviews.Author: CitySwansea
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Comfort Inn, room was nicely furnished and very clean, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The breakfast was very nice and plentiful, we were already aware of the plastic cutlery, but it didn't spoil anything. Location was brilliant, our view from the bedroom was the Empire State Building, and Macey's just around the corner. No complaints whatsoever, would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again. Towels were changed every day.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but probably wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: PeterFraser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn for 3 nights at the start of October 09 with my other half and 2 daughters. Firstly, remember that this is not a 5 star hotel, after reading previous reviews I was open minded. The hotel is well situated in the centre of Manhattan, only a stones throw from Broadway and a 5 - 10 minute walk to Times Square. Most of the staff were helpful, however there were some exceptions. We were given room 1011 which was adequate in size but situated at the rear of the hotel with a view of a wall 10 ft away. The room was dark, but the good thing was that it was quiet. We only stayed in the room to sleep, so this was no real problem. The room was well appointed and had been recently decorated, it wasnâ€™t the cleanest room I have stayed in, but the cleaner did come daily. The continental breakfast provided was good with bagels, waffles, toast, cereal, cakes, hot and cold drinks and others all provided. We usually went down about 09.30 in the morning, it was usually quite busy, getting a seat and table wasn't a real problem. We didn't eat in at Brendan's due to the number of other food outlets nearby. Out and about, we used the 48 hour hop on / off Grayline bus tour ticket to get about and see New York. We did the uptown, downtown and night tours which were all good, at worst some guides were mediocre, however some are very good, keeping the topics interesting. We never had a real problem getting on the top level of the bus. Times Square was good, always bustling with people and plenty shops and restaurants to choose from. The Empire States building is just around the corner from the hotel and Macyâ€™s is only a block away. If you are travelling on a budget and planning a busy time in Manhattan for a few nights this hotel would do. If your expectations are high I would give it a miss. There is nothing greatly wrong with this hotel, however it didnâ€™t give me the feeling that I would use it again if returning to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheilagriffiths18
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights and found the Hotel to be very good. The staff were always helpful, the rooms were clean and pleasant ( 10th and 6th floors ) Tea and coffee were available free twenty four hours a day, in the reception area. Brendans served a nice evening meal and complimentary breakfast was adequate for our needs. Location is great with Macys just yards away, and 5th and 6th avenues also close. Ten minutes walk gets you to Times Square, and the Empire State Building is around the block. Nice restaurants can be found opposite the hotel and plenty more just a short walk away. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: FrankieEssex
Reviews.Content: On checking in, the staff were unwelcoming and dismissive. On the journey to our room on the fifth floor, it became apparent that this hotel was in major need of redecoration and maintenance. After just 30 mins in our room, water started to pour from the ceiling. We went back down to reception to report this and were offered another room. No apology. The street noise is very noticeable if your room is situated to the front of the building and I would advise taking earplugs just incase. The heater was on for far too long and the air con was noisy. Surprisingly, the breakfast was pretty good, but you have to be there at 7 am in order to find somewhere to sit. On the last day, I flushed the loo and it emptied the contents and quite possibly the contents of some of the other guests toilets into our bathroom. I reported this, again no apology. Although this is a budget hotel and it does have a good location, the financial saving simply is not worth the hassle and disappointment of staying here. My advice, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “shabby and poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: bonnieEssex
Reviews.Content: 4 nights stay.in two rooms. , Entering one of the two rooms water was pouring from the ceiling,it was obviously an old leak as the ceiling paper was stained. Given another room with no apology whatsoever. The toilet in this room flooded on the last day. In the second room the key card did not work most of the time which resulted in having to go down to the lobby each time to get a new card, again no apology. The heating packed up in the second room. This was reported but nothing was done about it, again no apology. One of the two lifts broke down for a day. The attitude of the staff left a lot to be desired. The whole hotel was shabby except for the lobby and dining room. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wasn't the best”
Reviews.Author: JaneyfJaneyf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a tour across the US and i was very disappointed. the rooms were decorated really nicely but they were not clean. The staff were some times abrupt and the concierge could do with some retraining and definition on their role as they really didn't want to help. I really wanted this place to be good and feel that staff make a place and they really let the place down.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - around the corner from the Empire State Building”
Reviews.Author: dreamangel_uk
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel is classed as a bit of a budget choice, but to be honest you don't really need to spend a lot of money on a 5* hotel when staying in New York, because you're out most of the time sightseeing or eating out etc. The rooms were a little small, but clean and comfortable and the food was very nice, though there wasn't much choice. However, there are plenty of lovely places to eat close by - in fact, there are a few restaurants directly opposite the hotel entrance which served excellent food. The location of this hotel is excellent - you're literally around the corner from the Empire State Building, Macys and 5th Avenue, and it's about a 10-minute walk to Times Square. Whether you decide to stay at this hotel or another in Manhattan, it would be well worth your while purchasing a New York Pass (go to www.newyorkpass.com for full details). So long as you use as many of the offers in it as possible, it's money well-spent. It includes free entry to Madame Tussaud's, museums (and MUCH more) and discounts off sightseeing tours, which are unmissable if you haven't been to New York before. It would also be worth your while buying a weekly bus ticket, which can be purchased from the underground/subway self-service machines, as it will save you a lot of money. Try to only use the yellow taxis if you're going to use one at all - there are black ones as well which are more expensive. All the taxis will charge the same for transferring to/from the airport - at the time we travelled it was $45. If you're going to the Statue of Liberty and want to walk up to the top (inside of course!), you have to pre-book this a day in advance. If you just want to visit the island however, you can get your ticket on the day.

Reviews.Title: “bumpy start, but 2nd room fine- great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: arimazes
Reviews.Content: Had a bad start, arriving late, and finding the bathroom to be 'inadequate' (or filthy). Eventually, having made a start on cleaning it (and then suddenly realising it was my honeymoon and I wasn't actually there to do the cleaning), they changed our room for the first night. When we got back on the second day, we'd been given a room on 12th floor which overlooked 35th Street (which was much quieter then the rooms at the back over looking the aircon units). Despite the slight hiccup at the start, I would stay here agin as the price for the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamahen46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights 23/24 august. We arrived early having sailed on Queen Mary & the staff were happy to store our luggage until check in at 3.They provided us with a map, & marked the Hotel so we could find it again! The location is great. Empire state building & Macy's both only 1 street away & Times Square a 10 min walk away.There are loads of restaurants & deli's close by.Unusually for New York, this hotel offers complimentary breakfast. On offer is cereal, doughnuts, muffins,boiled eggs, bagels & toast with hot drinks & juices.This is all self service, & yes, as another reviewer mentioned, all paper plates & plastic cutlery - but hey - it's free, & it's all fresh so don't complain.There is also a complimentary coffee machine in reception, & free internet access, although this was always busy.We used wifi in our room easily using our laptop.Our room was on the top floor (12) & was large,clean & comfortable.It had efficient air con - an absolute must in August with 30C & 86% humidity. There are ice dispensers on several floors & vending machines.Next door is a great deli serving cold drinks & great burgers & sandwhiches. We didn't try " Brendans" in house restaurant, the menu was quite pricey, even with 15% guest discount compared to other places we ate. I recommend the 2 Chipotle mexican grill " on 34th street parallel to the Hotel. Mexican fast food - try the Burrito Bowl - yummy & only $8.We had evening flights home & again, they stored our luggage for us.All in all, I would recommend this hotel for sightseeing & shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for getting around but average hotel accommodation”
Reviews.Author: HolidayJunky007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just around the coner from the Empire State building and Macey's with plenty of restaurants near by. Well positioned to get around Manhattan. The hotel itself was a little dated but the room was clean and sizeable for the price paid as was the bathroom. The decor was in need of an update. The room was booked last minute so I ended up in a smoking room (I'm a non-smoker) so the lingering smell of tobacco may cloud my judgment some what (sorry for the pun!). The hotel is OK for the traveller on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “New York Brill!!!!!!!!! Hotel ??????”
Reviews.Author: thecaddens
Reviews.Content: We booked a dream holiday with Virgin hol's. Boston, New York and Washington for our Silver Wedding Annversary. Couldn't wait to get to new york and our hotel. What a let down! When we arrived at reception we must have had the same receptionist as the other reviewer who were there same time as us. There was no greeting from her just asked us for our credit card, told us our room number and that was it. Where was the big greeting and 'have a nice day'. The other staff were no better and if you go into the bar don't expect a good welcome or chat from the barman it was like pulling teeth talking to him. We were on the 8th floor dark small and uneven floors, and that was the the corridors. Our room was dark, brown and tan couldnt see out of both windows quite depressing really. A/C was old and loud but beds were clean and lovely just what you need after all the walking around new york. Breakfast is quite a surprise never seen anything like it plastic knives, forks and spoons, paper plates and paper cups. God help you if the butter is hard I broke 3 knives trying to spread it on my bagel. The hotel is fine just for washing, showering and sleeping and spend the day out. One warning do not get tickets for the red buses from the hotel, they advertise to get your tickets there but you are only paying their commission ( Our happy receptionist served us again but never told us til we paid up )you still have to get your tickets from the bus company to travel on them, which I do recommend they are brillant and the guides are great fun you also get tickets for empire state and ellis island with the bus tickets saves queuing up. New York is fantastic and I would go again and stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Started great, ended badly!!!”
Reviews.Author: ipodgone
Reviews.Content: My overall experience at Comfort Inn was fine,until the last day. I left my luggage in locked up room downstairs for about 8 or so hours, when I returned My I pod,and jewelery was not there. There is no disclaimer saying that you leave luggage at your own risk, and I have left luggage numerous times at other hotels/hostels. The reason that I am so angry is that after contacting the Hotel no one is willing to help me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - hotel just OK”
Reviews.Author: MTLEurope
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this hotel. The location is fantastic and the hotel is clean. If this is what you are looking for - then it is the perfect spot. However - be aware that the room pictures you see on the website is not necessarly representative of the room you may get. We stayed in room 409. The deficiencies in the room are uncalled for. They have maintenance issues. The light switch in the entry way is croocked. In the bathroom, the cold water tap is broken and you need to press down and turn to get the water out. (I can't believe that the chambermaid has not reported this.) The shelf placed over the sink is actually in your face when you brush your teeth and there is just no place to put your stuff. There is no curb shower curtain rod. The ceiling in the bathroom is damaged and the paint is peeling. There is some mold surrounding the bathtub. There is only one pole to place your towels. Our room was facing another building - I can understand - however the windows were so dirty that it added to the darkness of the room! Overall the employees are pleasant. I specially find Ms. Gulbye very nice, pleasant and helpful. However - during my stay I dealt with another lady with no name tags (slim, black always working the day shift) which obviously whished to be anywhere else but there! She was polite but this is it. Impatient and not at all friendly. You can tell that we were disturbing her. We have encountered pure strangers on the street more helpful then her. She should not be working in the industry. All this being said - the hotel is fine as long as you need a good clean place to sleep in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good room - very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: stewartmck77
Reviews.Content: This comfort inn is in a great midtown location right next to the empire state building. The hotel reception staff were friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and comfortable (queen bed - should have gone for king). Very clean. Free breakfast is basic but better than nothing. Overall very happy with this. Unfortunately staff couldn't accomodate an early checkin request as I arrived in NYC at 7am and had to wait till 1230 to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Adventures in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: anitansandra
Reviews.Content: A small friendly hotel,dated yes but is that not history in the making???? [check out the stained glass windows in reception/bar area] Our room was on the 12th floor which we requested, it was clean and roomy with the added bonus of a magnificent view of The Empire State ;the bathroom was adequate with plenty of hot water and a daily abundance of fresh towels, soaps, shampoo etc.The staff that we encountered were more than helpful and the lady that worked reception through the night was lovely,always available with advice and for a chat and even booked us in on line for our journey home bless her!!!! The location of this hotel was ace,we were within walking distance of so many of the attractions and those that were further afield we walked to anyway as to see New York you have to do it on foot in order not to miss anything!! [take VERY comfortable shoes]!!!!!!!!! Breakfast was a bonus and kept us going until mid afternoon and Brendans Bar served delicious food-the lamb chops were gorgeous and the staff in there were a friendly bunch too.On the whole, if what you are looking for is a hotel in a good location,that's clean,friendly and doesn't cost mega bucks this is the one.New York was our first trip to "The States" we are now planning on visiting elsewhere in the good old U S of A.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, decor a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: LMM48
Reviews.Content: Reviews on this site very useful and realistic. Hotel was ina very handy location for visiting all tourist attractions. Every staff member friendly and keen to help and advise. room spacious for a city, especially compared to European hotels. Room decor a little sad and tired eg broken floor tiles in bathroom. However didn't spend much time in hotel too much to see. New York a fantastic city, felt completely safe at all times. Open top tourist buses great value, we had a 3 day ticket and used it to get everywhere. Food at Brendan's very tasty and good prices with the 15% off. 2 Irish bars across the road also good,especially if you've had a hectic day.

Reviews.Title: “great location, quiet room, awesome bed!!”
Reviews.Author: techwreck09
Reviews.Content: we loved this place - it's not fancy but it's SUPER clean, the location is great (W. 32nd, AKA Korean Way - lots of places on the street open for noodles, etc. 24/7), the bed has a memory foam mattress that was divine to come home to after beating the pavement sun up to sun down every day, and we didn't hear a PEEP of street noise - partial thanks to the in-room AC unit which we ran all night. in room safe was also a plus. rooms are not huge, but this is generally to be expected in NY and since we weren't planning to do in-room gymnastics we didn't find this to be a problem. drawbacks? walls are a little thin and we had inconsiderate neighbors slamming doors on the first night (we always carry earplugs for just such a thing but this was really loud...). also the free breakfast is a feeding frenzy - good for a quick pick me up before you hit the streets, but might do better to grab a bite & head for the room like we did. elevators are a little slow but that didn't bother us. last time i was in NY i stayed at Affinia for about $250 a night, and i got MUCH better rest here, MUCH better value. VERY PLEASED and WILL STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great position of hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay, hotel was in a perfect position. Right by the Empire State Building, and at the end of the block Mac'ys. Times square was about a 10 min walk away. Our room was 807 which has been refurbished and when you looked out of the window you could see the Empire State building. Room was cleaned every day and clean towells left. Large closet and plenty of storage space. Breakfast was good, bagels, toast cereals, fruit, waffles. We never had to wait for a table usually got there between 8.30-9.00. Loverly Korean restaurant opposite hotel very reasonable too. We bought a New York City Tours 3 day bus ticket which cost Â£48 each, which included entry to Emprie State building and ferry ride over to Statue of Libery. Their night tour also stopped in Brooklyn and you were able to get off and take pictures of Brooklyn bridge and New York Skyline. Would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, ideal for the money, should not complain!”
Reviews.Author: trosk12
Reviews.Content: The staff was ok, the lady receptionist's very helpful opposed to the males who were a little on the grumpy side. The breakie was abundant, eat as much as you like with good service. The room was large, could of done having double glazing to keep the noise out, but anyhow thats NY loud and full of life. Location was ideal, everything you want is within 30 mins walk. Ideal place if you are on a budget, dont expect the Waldorf here as you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a better location”
Reviews.Author: fics112
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a Virgin package for four days. Room typical city centre with one exception...a great top to bottom view of the Empire State Building out of our hotel window. 500 yards to the Empire State or Macy's, 7 blocks from Times Square and the theatres. This was an ideally located hotel in the heart of the city. Breakfast pretty good also. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell1092
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband did a twin holiday with Virgin going to New York and Las Vegas. On arrival to this hotel we were greeted by staff who weren't that friendly and really quite grumpy. Our room had a good view of the Empire State building but there was some building work going on outside which continued thoughout the night. When asked to move rooms staff didn't seem to care or want to help. Also the cold tap in our room didn't work and our toilet got blocked. We went to breakfast to find we had to use plastic knives and forks and paper plates and plastic cups which we drank watered down juice from. Overall the location of this hotel is great but the hotel is not so great. All we were looking for was a place to sleep and use as a base, however the disruptions in the night meant we didn't even get a good nights sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: CherubCambridge
Reviews.Content: We did read some bad reviews but were surprized that the Hotel was so good for the price paid. Virgin Holidays 4 nights including flights and transfers Â£600 per person, what a bargain. Hotel so very central. Good staff at reception very busy but efficient. Free Internet. Rooms Clean and OK but have a look at your room first, we gathered that they were not all as good as ours. Plenty of clean towels and hot water An old hotel but plenty of character. Breakfast OK Orange Juice and coffee and toast plentiful. I bought a jar of marmelade and took it down with me. Not much seating but we used the bar area and sat in the window..great. Overall a very good experience for four Saga louts ! We ate out all the time, once you get out of the centre it gets much cheaper and the food much better. Wine Â£30 bottle on average. Little Italy is great for people watching. We avoided the loop bus at $44 and stayed on the public buses which were great and frequent. We even went to Harlem and got off the bus had a meal and the got back on the bus and did the complete circle. Everyone is very chatty on the bus and advice is plentyful. They only accept loose change and the bus fare is $2 each where ever you go and you can change buses as long as it is within 2 hours. Had a super break. If you want a museum then go the The Frick your mouth will drop open what an experience

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Cloggy8
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews before setting off i was a little concered. On arrival we were greeted (if thats what you can call it) by the staff who hardly spoke unless it was to each other!! Once we were in the room, we stayed on the 6th floor in 609 and it was lovely, Clean, nice size, Very comfy queen size bed, View of the empire state building. Flat screen tv, nice size bathroom, safe (which you have to pay $1.09 per day for) in all pretty good. We did not try the breakfast, room service or the connecting restaurant. The location was fantastic, right between Macy's and the empire state building. Subway station just on the corner which was very handy. A wicked pizza place on the same corner (try the pepperoni roll, very nice). The only really bad thing to say which wasn't the hotels doing, was behind the hotel they are building, and banging and drilling at all hours through the night. Don't let this put you off though because In all I would stay here again for its location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: spudly187
Reviews.Content: Me and friends decided to spend a week over New Years in this hotel and was very pleased. The room was basic but we expected it to be due to our budget and the title of the hotel. We had everything we needed though. The staff we so helpful as this was our first time in New York the receptionist got a map out and spent the next 30-45mins showing us where to go which was nice as we had in our heads what to do but he showed us the best way of doing it in the time we had. We had breakfast included in our deal which was in the resturant next door. The buffet offered everything you could think of tea, coffee, juice, bagels, toast, ceral the lot!!! The hotel was in a prime location with only a short walk to all the main sights. I would definatly think of staying here again due to the friendly staff and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: galacsea
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for comfort and convenience at a reasonable cost. My room was small but clean and recently remodeled, it seems. The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms on the streetside can be noisy, but new york is a noisy place.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for your holiday.”
Reviews.Author: The_Cocktail_Queen
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner visited this hotel on a twin centre holiday in December '08 with Virgin Holidays (twinned with Las Vegas). The hotel is in an ideal location for exploring all of Manhattan, its very central, turn left youve got Macy's at the end of the street turn left and your on 5th Avenue and at the Empire State Building! The hotel is small and tired but as this was my first time to New York i didnt know what to expect but from what i know now unless you pay top dollar this is the norm. In all fairness it is just a base for your holiday. Eat breakfast somewhere else though! We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant once and you had to eat from a paper plate with a plastic knife and fork! Yet during the day in the same place they serve delicious food and and drinks with great service.. couldnt work this one out! The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpfull. But is is one of those hotels that your sat on the coach waiting to be dropped at your hotel and think 'ooh hope thats not mine' and it is! I highly recommend a full helicopter trip! Highlight of the whole holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very kind staff and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: garoZadar
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in hotel and it was realy nice expirience. We were suprised how near is Times Square. The staff were realy kind. We had even breakfast in our price, which is not so tipically for hotels in NYC. We were also suprised how quite was in room. I would definietly recommend this hotel and I we will probably come back one day in this hotel. WE LOVE NYC!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “execllent value”
Reviews.Author: psycho3
Reviews.Content: we stayed there 3 times in total,a girlie trip,a part honeymoon trip. and a cuppels trip, every thing is with in walking distance,easy to get around, a great base , getting to and from. would like some tea and coffee making facilities that would be haven on earth after sight seeing and shopping all day,also set you up first thing in the morning,with out having to go down bug eyed to breakfast, having said all that , i would go back there again after all, its location, location,location

Reviews.Title: “cheap,comfortable,central,clean,come stay there .”
Reviews.Author: trolleydolly79
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews of this hotel and wondered what on earth i was letting myself in for,even pulling up to the hotel i was rather dubious but once in the reception was greeted by the desk staff in a friendly way that put any niggling doubts to rest,lady behind the desk gave mummy and myself maps and lots of useful info and reminded us that the breakfast was complimentary .Rooms were a good size(by NYC standards) clean and had all we needed, at this point i must question the doubting thomases who complain about the rooms,what exactly are you looking for ? surely a bedroom in NYC is a base from which to explore the city,it is not known as a city that attracts people to book a room in which to stay in all day and relax,surely other wonderful cities would suit far better for"getting away and unwinding". Location is spot on,empire state building to the right,macys to the left,subway a hop,skip and jump away........now what more could you need ? Others have "dissed"the breakfast but my mother and i were very happy with it,oatmeal,toast,bagels,cereal,buns,donuts,juice,hot drinks-a lovely choice and if that doesnt set you up in the morning then sure you can go expand the waistline and arterys all you like in one of the many diners close by. If you have booked this hotel and are now worried about some reviews then please put those worries aside,by all means it is not the waldorf astoria but if that is your usual standard of hotel then pay an awfully lot more ,but for reasonable rate stay here,(all the more spending pennies for the shops) :-) Tip: transfers can be expensive-book super shuttle,hotel-jfk 2 people 38$. hotel will give you number.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a tour group”
Reviews.Author: WarlandJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a school group of 30 kids and would highly recommend it for its central location, close to Herald Square, Times Square, Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens, subway access & plenty of shopping for our students! If you're a budget traveler who doesn't need to be surrounded by luxury to survive a holiday, and would rather get out on the street to experience the city, this is the place to stay. We liked the quaint old-fashioned spiraling staircase & outside mason brick exterior; sure beats the modern-day boxy looking concrete buildings. There was a bit of construction/renovation noise to deal with but we were up early every day so that didn't really affect our visit. My only disappointment was with the breakfast buffet, which featured mostly starchy 'white food' like bread, muffins, toaster waffles, baked (not boiled) bagels, boiled eggs and 2 types of cereal. The only fruit was whole oranges and apples. This became tedious after a week and we found ourselves hunting for other varieties of fruit & cereals for breakfast.
